Title: Disbursements can be searched using the default search criterion
Description:
The screenshot above shows the initial set of search criterion loadout in Disbursement.
 
Additional search criterion that aren't the default set are tested in a separate test case.
 
Things to Test
 
For each criterion, enter a value and search in the application
Then validate the search result by using the same field to search against ExpertQuery.Disbursement.
 
Finally, test some arbitrary combinations of the criterion (some examples below)
 
select *
from ExpertQuery.Disbursement
where ExpertDisbInitiated = 0
and TransactionDate > '2002-09-01 17:08:36.407'
and IncurringOfficeId = 'TLH'
 
select *
from ExpertQuery.Disbursement
where ExpertDisbInitiated = 0
and TransactionDate > '2000-01-01 17:08:36.407'
and DisbursementTypeId = 'cour'
 
 
Individual criterion test details:
 
Disb ID:
 
select *
from ExpertQuery.Disbursement
where ID > 3000
order by Id asc
 
Also test via inserting multiple Id's.
 
Status:
 
exec SECURITY.SetContextByName 'Aderant_ap\franklin.liu' --Security affects # of rows returned, set your security context to ensure best results
select *
from ExpertQuery.Disbursement
where DisbursementStatus in ('E',
'R'
,'W'
--,'P','B','X','C'
)
 
select *
from CXL_CODE_LOOKUP
where LOOKUP_GROUP = 'DisbStatus' --Expected statuses
order by DISPLAY_SEQ asc
 
Currency
 
select distinct CurrencyId --find the currencies in use by existing disbursements
from ExpertQuery.Disbursement
 
select *
from ExpertQuery.Disbursement
where CurrencyId = 'YEN'
 
Session
 
select SessionId,*
from ExpertQuery.Disbursement a
where SessionId > 0
order by a.SessionId asc
 
select *
from ExpertQuery.Disbursement
where SessionId in(1, 2)
 
Cost Code
 
select distinct COST_CODE
from CDT_DISB
 
select DisbursementTypeId, *
from ExpertQuery.Disbursement a
where DisbursementTypeId = 'COPY'
 
Tran Date
 
Note that WPF app control only supports '<' and '>' as operatros
 
select *
from ExpertQuery.Disbursement a
where TransactionDate > '2000-07-01 00:00:00.000'
 
Client/Matter
 
Note that from the application, you're entering matter code, whereas in SQL we're searching by Matter_uno
 
select *
from ExpertQuery.Disbursement a
where MatterId = 1
 
Disb Office
 
Note that we use IncurringOfficeId here instead of OfficeId, if you use the wrong field to search in SQL the numbers won't match.
 
select IncurringOfficeId, *
from ExpertQuery.Disbursement
where IncurringOfficeId = 'TLH'
 
ED initiated
 
Note that while in the application we use boolean for this field, the column data type is in bit (either 0 or 1)
 
select *
from ExpertQuery.Disbursement
where ExpertDisbInitiated = 0

Title: Disbursements can searched using the additionally available search criterion
Description:
These are the additionally available search criterion for the Disbursement search grid:
 

Things to test:
 
Authorizing employee:
 
select AuthorizingEmployeeId, *
from ExpertQuery.Disbursement
where AuthorizingEmployeeId <> 0
 
select *
from CDT_DISB
where AU_EMPL_UNO <> 0
　
update CDT_DISB
set AU_EMPL_UNO = 100171
where DISB_UNO = 3358
 
update CDT_DISB
set AU_EMPL_UNO = 0
where DISB_UNO = 3358

Title: Expert Disb: Ctrl+O opens from the grid
Description:
This testcase is to ensure that the Ctrl+O functionality correctly opens up disbursements/sessions.

Ensure the screen displays correct information.
Ensure it is editable as long as it was created in Expert.

1. On the Disbursement Tab, open a Disbursement created in Expert Disbursements.
2. On the Disbursement Tab, open a Disbursement created in Classic.
3. On the Sessions Tab, open a Session created in Expert Disbursements.
4. On the Sessions Tab, open a Sessions created in classic.

Title: Expert Disb: Escape key will close a disbursement card.
Description:
We need to ensure that the Escape Key functionality works correctly. 

1. Create new disbursements and click the Escape Key. It will close without saving.
2. Edit a disbursements and click the Escape Key. It will close without saving.
3. Create a new disbursement in a Session and click the Escape Key. It will close without saving.
4. Edit a disbursement in a Session and click the Escape Key. It will close without saving.


Make sure it updates the database correctly.

order by LAST_MODIFIED desc

select * from CDS_DISB_Z
order by LAST_MODIFIED desc

Title: Release Unrelease Disb - Classic Disb
Description:
Check that disbursements created outside Expert Disbursement cannot be released 
Sometimes disbursements will be created inside sessions, sometimes not - we'll test what could be generated from these applications
 
Applications that can create disbursements are:
- Classic
- Expenses
- Billing
- Accounts Payable
 
(This should be the complete list...)
 
Tables & columns concerned: 
CDT_DISB.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP
 
Testing approach
 
Setup data from the other applications (see above list)
 
Then use a similar SQL to pull back the different types of disbs to search for:
 
select *
from cdt_disb
where SOURCE_TRAN_TYP in ('AP'
--,'PCT'
--,'APX'
,'CH'
--,'AD'
) 
 
Open Expert Disbursements and look for those disbursements (ED_INITIATED = N or not set)
 
Check the available actions
Perform check (release / unrelease, in this case)
- For unrelease, we might need to use the application and/or classic to toggle the release state for checking unrelease...

Title: Release Unrelease Session - Disb with Alert and Rule Violations
Description:
Check with sessions having just one disbursement with an alert
Also check sessions with multiple disbursements with a single alert, and multiple alerts, too.
 
Assumptions are:
- User has security
- All disbs are ED initiated
- Source tran type = CDN (follows from above)
- All Disbs are not released (in edit state)
 
On release (or the attempt), we expect the following
- Dialog message displaying the validation rule we're violating
 
No state change expected in the table (CDS_DISB_Z or CDT_DISB)
Steps: Step 1: Release Disbursements with violation- Attach rule to matter via Entity Manager- Create disbursements that violate the rule. Save disbs.- Select the created disbursement. | Expected: Release button is enabled.Click Release button - Prompted with validation error, disbursement is not released. || Step 2: Release Multiple Disbursements with violation- Attach rule to matter via Entity Manager- Create multiple disbursements that violate the rule. Save disbs.- Select the created disbursements. | Expected: Release button is enabled.Click Release button - Prompted with validation error, disbursement is not released.Each disbursements have their own alert message in Recent Activity.

Title: Release Unrelease Session - Validation
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqA Disbursement Session with 2 disbursement records. || Step 2: Release Disbursement Sesssion | Expected: CDS_DISB_Z.status = 'R'All related CDT_DISB records status = 'R'Session is not editable.Disbursment status updated on grid. || Step 3: Unrelease Disbursement Sesssion | Expected: CDS_DISB_Z.status = 'E'All related CDT_DISB records status = 'E'Session is editable.Disbursment status updated on grid.

Title: Edit List - Session - Report requirement
Description:
A likely scenario, hence Base test Priority 3.
 
In this situation, a user must satisfy the Edit list requirements
(note: The above was from Client Disbursements -> Dibursement setup -> Parameters)
 
Or on the employee itself:

There are equivalent in places where you can set this in WPF world (Expert Administration, Entity Manager), but the above were pretty straightforward places to set this.
 
If the requirement is met, the user CAN initiate release
 
If the requirement is not met, the user is show a dialog.
 
In order to satisfy the edit list report requirement in Expert, you do something...to finish.
 
Note: In classic users can unrelease sessions even if edit list is required and the session hasn't been printed (makes sense to me). We should clarify with Dave to see if this makes sense in Expert too.
Test the above assumption works as expected in Expert.
 
Testing Approach
 
Repeat the below approach for these scenarios:
- Edit list required set in Disbursement parameters
- Edit list required set on the user, but not in the disbursement parameters
 
When an edit list has been printed, the CDS_DISB_Z row is updated:
 
update CDS_DISB_Z set PRINTED = 'Y', LAST_MODIFIED = getdate() where SESSION=70                                                                      
Given we're blocked by 176433, we'll have to use SQL to update the session in order to test this.
Steps: Step 1: see Summary for test

Check with just one disbursement with an alert
Also check multiple disbursements with a single alert, and multiple alerts, too.
 
Assumptions are:
- User has security
- All disbs are ED initiated
- Source tran type = CDN (follows from above)

Save disbs.- Select the created disbursements. | Expected: Release button is enabled.Click Release button - Prompted with validation error, disbursement is not released.Each disbursements have their own alert message in Recent Activity.Bug 271111 - Disb Release and Post: Release and Post buttons should not be enabled when the disbursement has errors

This outline was copied from 177902. The content from this point is largely the same, except the tables we're looking at is CDT_DISB instead of CDS_DISB_Z
 
Specifically for this test case though, we need to test that the sessions can be released / unreleased given some assumptions.
We're not testing security, nor edit list report requirements, nor disbursements / sessions created outside Expert Disbursement. Pretty much the happy path test, hence Base test + Priority 1.
 
Data checking happens here - we're going to compare with the output we've gotten from doing the same operation in classic.
 
Testing approach
 
Tables concerned: 
CDT_DISB
 
 Note that there is no equivalent scenario in classic, as disbursements must sit inside a session. Therefore we expect the same thing that happened for disbursement sessions to happen here (changing the CDT_DISB.EXPERT_DISB_STATUS value)
 
Create a disbursement in Classic, and check the logs (CTRL + SHIFT + L)
Create a disbursement inside Expert Disbursement, and check the CDT_DISB table. Compare the two entries - expect EXPERT_DISB_STATUS to be null for the classic entry. (Also ED_INITATED = null)
 
Repeat the testing approach for the following scenarios:
- Selecting single disbursement with edit status - User can release
- Selecting multiple disbursements with edit status - user can release
- Selecting multiple disbursements with released status - Users can unrelease
- Selecting multiple disbursements with mixed status - no release / unrelease option is available
 
Then release the disbursement. See what has changed in CDT_DISB - we expect EXPERT_DISB_STATUS to change to R
 
Then unrelease the disbursement. See what has changed in CDT_DISB - we expect EXPERT_DISB_STATUS to changed back to E
Steps: Step 1: Release disb <> 'CDN' type and in Edit status | Expected: Release button disabled. || Step 2: Release when edit list required | Expected: Release button enabled. Clicking it pops up 'Edit List has not been printed' info. || Step 3: Release without security | Expected: Release button disabled. || Step 4: Release Classic created | Expected: Release button disabled || Step 5: Release released disb | Expected: Release button disabled, Unrelease button enabled.

Title: Edit List - Disb - Report requirement
Description:
Note: Content below is copied from 177906 - it's the same thing except transposed into the disbursement scenario.
 
A likely scenario, hence Base test Priority 3.
 
In this situation, a user must satisfy the Edit list requirements
(note: The above was from Client Disbursements -> Dibursement setup -> Parameters)
 
Or on the employee itself:

There are equivalent in places where you can set this in WPF world (Expert Administration, Entity Manager), but the above were pretty straightforward places to set this.
 
If the requirement is met, the user CAN initiate release
 
If the requirement is not met, the user is show a dialog.
 
 
In order to satisfy the edit list report requirement in Expert, you do something... which will be known when 173426 is done.
 
Note: In classic users can unrelease sessions even if edit list is required and the session hasn't been printed (makes sense to me). We should clarify with Dave to see if this makes sense in Expert too.
 
Testing approach
 
Repeat the below approach for these scenarios:
- Edit list required set in Disbursement parameters
- Edit list required set on the user, but not in the disbursement parameters
 
 
At this point in time, we don't have the ability to go through the Edit List path. So we'll need to do some SQL magic:
 
update CDT_DISB
set EDIT_REPORT_PRINT_REF = 666
where DISB_UNO = 3467
 
You should be able to release the disbursement now.
**Remember that after SQL script is run, you'll need to re-search for the disbursement in order to be able to release, as the returned object is still at the 'old state' of having 0 as the edit list reference number
 
This will kick off a job:
 

 select DISB_UNO, EXPERT_DISB_STATUS,ED_INITIATED, EDIT_REPORT_PRINT_REF,LAST_MODIFIED
from CDT_DISB
where DISB_UNO in (1861, 3467)
 
EXPERT_DISB_STATUS should now update from E to R
 
**Note that in order to unrelease, there are no other requirements except for the disbursement to be in the "released" state. We don't have to test this in this test case if short on time.
Steps: Step 1: See summary for test

Title: Unposted Disb Edit - Open Existing Disb
Description: This is to ensure that the Open screen looks and operates correctly.
Steps: Step 1: Log in as user that does not have Disbursements.CreateDisbursement set up in Security Manager but make sure they have access to the application. Search for a Disbursement and click Open. | Expected: User can review the disbursement but cannot edit anything. || Step 2: Log in as a user that has permissions and Search and Open a Disbursement from the main Disbursement tab. (Screen layout is attached.) Make a change to any of the fields. | Expected: Session field will be 0. Review the database: select * from CDT_Disb order by LAST_MODIFIED desc. The newly create Disbursement should have data correct, including ED_Initiated field set to 'Y' and Expert_Disb_Status field set to 'E'. || Step 3: Search for disbursements and ensure there are multiple Disbursements in the grid. Highlight multiple disbursements. | Expected: Open button will be grayed out. Right Click will have the 'Open' option grayed out. || Step 4: Search for disbursements and ensure there are multiple Disbursements in the grid. Right click and select Export to Excel/Export All Rows. | Expected: There will be the same number in the Excel spreadsheet as exist in the list. || Step 5: Search for disbursements and ensure there are multiple Disbursements in the grid. Do a Ctrl+A to get all the rows, right click and select Export to Excel/Export Selected Rows. | Expected: There will be the same number in the Excel spreadsheet as exist in the list. || Step 6: Search for disbursements and ensure there are multiple Disbursements in the grid. Select several rows, right click and select Export to Excel/Export Selected Rows. | Expected: There will be the same number in the Excel spreadsheet as were selected in the list.

It will still be there after the Disbursement is deleted.The Disbursements will exist here when created: select * from cdt_disb order by LAST_MODIFIED desc. The Disbursement deleted will be gone after the delete.   Note: Attached will show up. Deleting can't perform.

Steps: Step 1: Create a new disbursement in Expert Disb. | Expected: Expert_Disb_Status field will be 'E' and Ed_Initiated will be equal to 'Y' || Step 2: Create Disbursements in Classic. | Expected: Expert_Disb_Status field will be 'E' and Ed_Initiated will be equal to 'N' || Step 3: As you change their statuses in the system it should update the database accordingly. | Expected: Expert_Disb_Status field will be E (Edit), ​R (Released), ​W (WIP), ​P (Prebill), ​B (Billed), ​X (Cancelled)

Title: Expert Disb: New DB fields for Accounts Payable
Steps: Step 1: Create a Disbursement in  Accounts Payable. (Go to Invoices and select New. After you fill out the Vendor information the Disbursements Tab at the bottom will be used to create new Disbursements.) | Expected: In the cdt_disb table the new fields will have the following values: ED_Initiated = 'Y' Expert_Disb_Status = 'E'. || Step 2: Edit the Disbursement and review the data in the DB. | Expected: New information will save.

Title: Expert Disb: New DB Fields Billing
Steps: Step 1: Create a Disbursement in Billing. | Expected: In the cdt_disb table the new fields will have the following values: ED_Initiated = 'Y' Expert_Disb_Status = 'P'. || Step 2: Edit the Disbursement and review the data in the DB. | Expected: New information will save. || Step 3: Release the Disbursement. | Expected: In the cdt_disb table the new fields will have the following values: Expert_Disb_Status = 'R'. || Step 4: Unrelease the Disbursement. | Expected: In the cdt_disb table the new fields will have the following values: Expert_Disb_Status = 'E'. || Step 5: Post the Disbursement. | Expected: In the cdt_disb table the new fields will have the following values: Expert_Disb_Status = 'W'. || Step 6: Create a Prebill | Expected: In the cdt_disb table the new fields will have the following values: Expert_Disb_Status = 'P'. || Step 7: Create a Bill | Expected: In the cdt_disb table the new fields will have the following values: Expert_Disb_Status = 'B'. || Step 8: Create a Disbursement then cancel it. | Expected: In the cdt_disb table the new fields will have the following values: Expert_Disb_Status = 'X'.

Title: Jobs - Recent Activity
Steps: Step 1: Create a disbursement and Release it. | Expected: A notification will occur on the little bell icon on the top right of the screen. The recent activity Tab will have it listed correctly. || Step 2: Take a released disbursement and Unrelease it. | Expected: A notification will occur on the little bell icon on the top right of the screen. The recent activity Tab will have it listed correctly. || Step 3: Create a disbursement and Post it. | Expected: A notification will occur on the little bell icon on the top right of the screen. The recent activity Tab will have it listed correctly. || Step 4: Create a disbursement that will generate an alert. | Expected: A notification will occur on the little bell icon on the top right of the screen that there is an error. The recent activity Tab will have it listed correctly as an alert.

Title: Post Disb - Basic Post - Multicurrency
Description: This is to test posting a disbursement from the disbursement list when there isn't an auto split associated.
Steps: Step 1: Create a CAD $100 disbursement and Post it. Rate = 1.09200778410000Recip = 0.915744388053213 | Expected: Edit button should become enabled. || Step 2: Verify CDT_DISB | Expected: Base_Amt, ToBill_Amt and Std_Amt converted to System Currency : $91.5744388053. (UI still displays in disb currency)WIP_Status will be 'W'.Post Date will be today. (00:00:00)DRUNO and Period will be populated.Expert_Disb_Status = 'W'.ED_Initiated = 'Y'.OFFC,DEPT,PROF populated based on CDM_PARMS setting. || Step 3: New record created in CDT_DISB_NEW | Expected: Fields should identical to CDT_DISB. || Step 4: Updates or creates CDH_SUMMARY_GL row | Expected: BASE_NEW and TOBILL_NEW updated if there are existing row for COST_CODE, PERIOD, MATTER combination. Else created new row with these values. || Step 5: Updates or created TBH_MATTER_SUMM row | Expected: HARD/SOFT_TOT, HARD/SOFT_WIP_BAL, HARD/SOFT_COUNT updated if there are an existing row for the matter. Else creates new row with these values.

Title: Post Disb - Post with Auto and Delayed Split
Description: This is to test posting a disbursement from the disbursement list when there is an auto split associated.
Steps: Step 1: Create a disbursement for the client/matter set up with Auto Split.Post it | Expected: The disbursement will automatically split into that you indicated in the setup as soon as the disb is posted. The percentage field is for the new item setup. The original will get the balance.Base_Amt, ToBill_Amt and Std_Amt converted to System Currency. (UI still displays in disb currency)WIP_Status will be 'W'.Post Date will be today. (00:00:00)DRUNO and Period will be populated.Expert_Disb_Status = 'W'.ED_Initiated = 'Y'.OFFC,DEPT,PROF populated based on CDM_PARMS setting. || Step 2: Create a disbursement for the client/matter set up with Delayed Split.Post it | Expected: The disbursement will DO NOT automatically split into that you indicated in the setup as soon as the disb is posted. The percentage field is for the new item setup. The original will get the balance.Base_Amt, ToBill_Amt and Std_Amt converted to System Currency. (UI still displays in disb currency)WIP_Status will be 'W'.Post Date will be today. (00:00:00)DRUNO and Period will be populated.Expert_Disb_Status = 'W'.ED_Initiated = 'Y'.OFFC,DEPT,PROF populated based on CDM_PARMS setting.

Title: Disbursements - Backstage Help links
Description: This is to ensure that the Help links do what they are supposed to.
Steps: Step 1: All of these checks are found in the Expert Disbursement application on the 'Expert' tab/Help button. | Expected: Links are found. || Step 2: Select 'ADERANT Expert Help'. | Expected: Your default browser will open Aderant's general help page. || Step 3: Select 'What is Expert Disbursement?' | Expected: Your default browser will open a page with a brief explanation of Disb application. || Step 4: Select 'Quick Tour'. | Expected: Your default browser will open a page with either a video of the Disb application or a message indicating that no video exists yet. || Step 5: Select 'Getting Started'. | Expected: Your default browser will open a Getting Started page for the Disb application. || Step 6: Select 'Core Tasks'. | Expected: Your default browser will open a page with high level instructions for the main functionality in the Disb Application. || Step 7: Select 'Getting Support'. | Expected: Your default browser will open to Aderant Expert's generic support page.

Title: Disb Session - Inline Edit
Steps: Step 1: In the Expert Disbursement application, create a Session. Then create a disbursement. | Expected: Disbursement saved. || Step 2: In the Grid, change the values of the editable fields. Review the database to ensure they saved: select * from cdt_disb order by LAST_MODIFIED desc .  (Verify that Currency Override is set to ON in parms) | Expected: Editable fields are: Authorizing Employee, Base Amount, Base Quantity, Client/Matter, Currency, Disb Code, Disb Employee, Disb Office, Hold Date, Location, Narrative, Phase/Task, Prebill Text, Project, Reference, ToBill Amount, Tran Date || Step 3: Make sure the fields that aren't supposed to be editable, aren't. | Expected: Non Editable fields are: Bill Number, Billable Status, Billed Amount, Billed Cost Code, Billed Employee, Billed Quantity, Created in Expert, Department, Disb ID, Entered by, Import Number, Last Modified, Latest Period, Office, Period, Posted Date, Prebill Number, Print on Bill, Print Ref, Profit Center, Source Type, Status, Standard Amount, TaxableBug 249060: Disb Session - All fields in grid appear editable after auto save

Title: Delete disb - with CreateDisbursement security
Steps: Step 1: Log into Expert Disb with a user that does not have 'CreateDisbursement' permissions. Search for disbursements. Try to delete one that has not been posted yet. | Expected: Delete button will be grayed out. Left click and the Delete button will be grayed out. Click the Delete key on your keyboard (it should not work). || Step 2: Log in with a user that has the 'CreateDisbursement' permission ticked. Try to delete a Disbursement in 'Edit' Status. | Expected: User will be able to delete. || Step 3: Log in with a user that has the 'CreateDisbursement' permission ticked. Try to delete multiple Disbursements in 'Edit' Status. | Expected: User will be able to delete. || Step 4: Log in with a user that has the 'CreateDisbursement' permission ticked. Try to delete a Disbursement in 'Release' Status. | Expected: User will not be able to delete.If you unrelease, you will be able to release. || Step 5: Log in with a user that has the 'CreateDisbursement' permission ticked. Try to delete a Disbursement in 'WIP' Status. | Expected: User will not be able to delete.User needs 'DeleteDisbursement' permission to delete posted disbursements. || Step 6: Log in with a user that has the 'CreateDisbursement' permission ticked. Search for a Disbursement created in Classic. Try to delete it. | Expected: User will not be able to delete. || Step 7: Log in with a user that has the 'CreateDisbursement' permission ticked. Try to delete a Disbursement in with a Source_Tran_Type that isn't 'CDN'. | Expected: User will not be able to delete.

Title: Expert Disb: Security: Disbursements - Without PostDisbursements user rights
Steps: Step 1: Log into Expert Disbursements with a user that has access to Disbursements but does not have the 'PostDisbursement' security permission. | Expected: User can look at the disbursement but will not be allowed to select the 'Post' button. || Step 2: Note: The rest of the tests require the PostDisbursement' security permission. || Step 3: Create a Soft Disbursement and put in all the required fields. Post the disbursement. | Expected: Disbursement will post. || Step 4: Create a Hard Disbursement and put in all the required fields. Post the disbursement. | Expected: Disbursement will post.

Title: Expert Disb: Security: No access to Sessions Tab
Description: This is to ensure that if the user does not have access to the 'Sessions' tab, they don't see it.
Steps: Step 1: Log into Expert Security Manager. In the Module Policies tab find the 'Disbursements' module. Copy it and name it Disbursements - No Sessions. | Expected: New Policy is created. || Step 2: Untick the Sessions box in the Disbursements section. Add one of the TTQA users to the group. Title: Expert Disb: Security: Sessions - CreateSession user rights
Description: This is to test user permissions when they have ​CreateSession. This will allow the user to create new session, add and edit incomplete disbursements from within the sessions section of the application, and allow the user to delete unposted sessions within sessions section.These permissions do not have any validations in the Classic Application and any Disbursements or Sessions created in Classic are unable to be edited in Expert Disbursement.
Steps: Step 1: Setup: In Security manager the user needs to have permissions to the Sessions Tab of Disbursements but all other 'Sessions' related items need to be unticked. | Expected: Setup correct. || Step 2: Log into the Disbursements system with user as set up above. | Expected: Sessions tab will be accessible. User can view but not create or edit new Sessions. || Step 3: Repeat but add 'CreateSession' as the permission and log back into the system. | Expected: User will be able to create new sessions. || Step 4: Delete the Session just created. | Expected: User will be able to delete session. || Step 5: Create a new Session and add several disbursements.Note: User will need 'CreateDisbursements' rights. | Expected: User creates the session. || Step 6: Delete the session. | Expected: User will be able to delete session. || Step 7: Create a new Session and add several disbursements. Post one disbursement.Note: User will need 'CreateDisbursements' and 'PostDisbursement' rights. | Expected: User will post disbursement. || Step 8: Try to delete the session. | Expected: User will not be able to delete session. Sessions cannot be deleted if there are posted Disbursements.

Title: Expert Disb: Security: Sessions - ReleaseSession user rights
Description: This is to test the ReleaseSessions user permissions in Security Manager. The user will be able to Release and Unrelease Sessions and the disbursements attached.These permissions do not have any validations in the Classic Application and any Disbursements or Sessions created in Classic are unable to be edited in Expert Disbursement.
Steps: Step 1: Setup: In Security manager the user needs to have permissions to the Sessions Tab of Disbursements but all other 'Sessions' related items need to be unticked. | Expected: Setup correct. || Step 2: Log into the Disbursements system with user as set up above. | Expected: Sessions tab will be accessible. User can view but not create or edit new Sessions. || Step 3: Repeat but add 'ReleaseSession' as the permission and log back into the system. | Expected: User will not be able to create new sessions. || Step 4: Find or Create a session with disbursements that are all in a new status.Note: They have to have been created in Expert. Otherwise you will have an error telling you that it wasn't created in Expert. | Expected: Session created. || Step 5: Release the session. | Expected: Session will release as will all the eligible Disbursements in the session. || Step 6: Unrelease the session. | Expected: Session will be changed to the 'Edit' status as will all the eligible Disbursements in the session. Note: If the Disbursement is Posted it will stay in that status.

Title: Expert Disb: Security: Sessions - PostSession user rights
Description: This is to test the PostSession user rights. The user will be able to post the session and all the eligible disbursements.These permissions do not have any validations in the Classic Application and any Disbursements or Sessions created in Classic are unable to be edited in Expert Disbursement.
Steps: Step 1: Setup: In Security manager the user needs to have permissions to the Sessions Tab of Disbursements but all other 'Sessions' related items need to be unticked. | Expected: Setup correct. || Step 2: Log into the Disbursements system with user as set up above. | Expected: Sessions tab will be accessible. User can view but not create or edit new Sessions. || Step 3: Repeat but add 'PostSession' as the permission and log back into the system. | Expected: User will not be able to create new sessions. || Step 4: Find or Create a session with disbursements that are all in a new or released status.Note: They have to have been created in Expert. Otherwise you will have an error telling you that it wasn't created in Expert. | Expected: Session created/found. || Step 5: Post the session. | Expected: Session will be posted as will all the eligible Disbursements in the session.

Title: Expert Disb: Security: Disbursements - CreateDisbursements user rights

Create a new disbursement. | Expected: User will be able to create new disbursements. || Step 4: Edit the unposted disbursement | Expected: disbursement is editable. || Step 5: Delete the disbursements just created. | Expected: User will be able to delete disbursement. || Step 6: Create a new disbursement. | Expected: Disbursement is created. || Step 7: Select the Open option and make some changes to the disbursement. | Expected: Changes will save. || Step 8: Find a Disbursement that is in a 'Released' status. Title: Disb Import - Minimum required fields and Import Wizard
Description: This testcase is for testing the minimum amount of field to get the importer to run. In the wizard currently, it is these fields:
Steps: Step 1: Review the Import Template attached. The fields are the minimum required fields for the importer to work correctly. || Step 2: Input data into the fields. Don't leave any blank:Client_Code: This is the Client you will be using. This is mostly a reference for the matter code.Matter_Code: This is the matter associated to the above Client. Maps to Matter_Uno in cdt_disb.Currency: This is the currency that the disbursement will be stored in until Posting. Maps to Currency_Code in cdt_disb.Amount: This is the amount of the disbursement. Maps to Base_Amt and ToBill_Amt in cdt_disb.Disb_Code: This is the disbursement code. All the codes will need to be either 'Hard' or 'Soft' codes. Maps to Cost_Code in cdt_disb.Office: This is the Office code. Maps to DI_OFFC in cdt_disb. | Expected: It actually doesn't matter what is in the header. This will just make it easier for mapping later.Bug 235873: BUG: Expert Disbursements import wizard requires an import number; it should be optionalAll of the 'This maps to whatever' parts of the description are assuming you set up the wizard correctly. || Step 3: Log into the Expert Disbursements application. On the Disbursements tab select the 'Import Disbursements' button on the toolbar. Security resource "ImportDisbursements" under Security Manager - Module Policies - Disbursements controls the status of the button:1 - The button is enabled when the security resource is ticked.2 - The button is disabled when the security resource is unticked. | Expected: The Importer Wizard will open. || Step 4: Navigate to your document. Select 'Create a new mapping profile.' and give it a new name. Keep going until the Disbursement Mapping page opens. | Expected: Page displays || Step 5: In the 'Data begins in row number' field select 2. Pick the correct Hard/Soft Option. The fields above should be mapped to the correct column number. | Expected: Setups will be correct. Attachment is an example. || Step 6: Select Next to get the Validation page. If it is valid select 'Import Disbu' button at the bottom. Job will process. | Expected: All the disbursements should process. select * from cdt_disborder by LAST_MODIFIED descIf bad data was put in, it will still put the data in the database but when you open the disbursement it will tell you that you need to fix the required field.

Title: Disb Import - Invalid file
Steps: Step 1: Note: I'm dumping some tests in here for now as there appears to be no test case for validation. Need one and move them out || Step 2: Employee is requiredWhen INEMP_REQD = Y and no employee is set SELECT COST_CODE, COST_DESC,ALLOW_HARD,ALLOW_SOFT,MARKUP_BASE,INEMP_REQD, AUEMP_REQD,HAS_UNIT_RATE,ALLOW_BASE_EDIT,TAX_OUT,MATCH_THRESHOLD--,*FROM CDL_COST cc WHERE INACTIVE!='Y'--AND ALLOW_HARD='Y'ORDERBY cc.COST_CODE | Expected: Invoice and disb are importedError on disb: Incurring Employee is required || Step 3: Invalid Currency As from 83Currency is invalid or empty | Expected: Import of the record fails Error message: Currency is invalid for ......Bug 246309 - Import: When currency is invalid, need to have the error message enhanced in order to help the user locate which record/s have failed || Step 4: Invalid Cost Code As from 83Cost Code is invalid or empty | Expected: Invoice and disb are imported Recent activity- Warning: Disbursement imported with errors- Hyperlink to disbursement Disbursement form bannerError message: The disbursement code xxx is invalid in disbursement (when the value is invalid)Error message: Disbursement code is empty (when the value is empty) || Step 5: Invalid Client/Matter code As from 83Client/Matter code is invalid or empty | Expected: Invoice and disb are imported Recent activity- Warning: Disbursement imported with errors- Hyperlink to disbursement Disbursement form bannerError message: The client code xxx and matter xxx combination is invalid (when the value is invalid)Error message: The client/matter could not be found (when the there is no client/matter code entered) || Step 6: Invalid Office As from 83Office is invalid | Expected: Invoice and disb are imported Recent activity- Warning: Disbursement imported with errors- Hyperlink to disbursement Disbursement form bannerError message: Incurring office xxx is invalid || Step 8: Select a blank xlsx file. | Expected: Error message will display.

Title: Disb Import - Map fields in the Import Wizard
Description: This testcase is for testing the minimum amount of field to get the importer to run. In the wizard currently, it is these fields:
Steps: Step 1: TEST CASE NEED TO BE REVIEW || Step 2: Review the Import Template attached. The fields are the minimum required fields for the importer to work correctly. || Step 3: Input data into the fields. Don't leave any blank:NOTE: Name listed first is the field in the Wizard. The name in () is what I've called it in the template. You can use whatever names you want as it is only for ease of mapping.Import Number (Import_Num): Maps to Import_Num in cdt_disb.Client Code (Client_Code): This is the Client you will be using. This is mostly a reference for the matter code.Matter Code (Matter_Code): This is the matter associated to the above Client. Maps to Matter_Uno in cdt_disb.Currency (Currency): Maps to Currency_Code in cdt_disb.Amount (Amount): Maps to Base_Amt and ToBill_Amt in cdt_disb.Disbursement Code (Disb_Code): All the codes will need to be either 'Hard' or 'Soft' codes. Maps to Cost_Code in cdt_disb.Office (Office): Maps to DI_Office in the CDT_Disb table. | Expected: All of the 'This maps to whatever' parts of the description are assuming you set up the wizard correctly. || Step 4: Additional Fields:Phase and Task (Phase/Task):  These two fields will compare to the Task_Code and Phase_Code in the TBL_PHTask table and put the PHTask_Uno in the CDT_Disb table in PHTask_Uno.Employee Code (Emp_Code): Maps to DI_EMPL_UNO in the CDT_Disb table.N/A (Name_Ref_DNU): Only reference if the user wants it.Authorizing Employee (Auth_Emp_Code): Maps to AU_EMPL_UNO in the CDT_Disb table.N/A (Auth_Name_DNU): Only reference if the user wants it. | Expected: All of the 'This maps to whatever' parts of the description are assuming you set up the wizard correctly. || Step 5: Additional Fields: Reference (Ref): This information will be mapped to Disb_Ref in the CDT_Disb table.Narrative and Prebill Narrative (Narrative/Prebill_Nar): The Narrative and Prebill_Nar will be mapped to the CDT_TEXT table. The Text_ID will then be put into the CDT_Disb table under NAR_TEXT_ID and PB_TEXT_ID.Disbursement Date (Disb_Date): Need to be within Min and Max date.Quantity (Quantity): This maps to BASE_QTY in CDT_Disb.Bill Quantity (Bill_Quant): This maps to BILL_QTY in CDT_Disb. | Expected: All of the 'This maps to whatever' parts of the description are assuming you set up the wizard correctly. || Step 6: Additional FieldsBill Amount (Bill_Amt): This maps to TOBILL_AMT in CDT_Disb. If blank, it will default to the 'Amount' above.Hold Date (Hold_Date): This maps to HOLD_DATE in CDT_Disb.Location(Location): This maps to LOCATION_CODE in CDT_Disb.Project (Project): This maps to PROJ in CDT_Disb.Image ID (Image_ID): This maps to EI_ID in CDT_Disb. || Step 7: Log into the Expert Disbursements application. On the Disbursements tab select the 'Import Disbursements' button on the toolbar. 'Import Disbursements' Button has a new security policy from 82SP2 onwards. | Expected: The Importer Wizard will open. || Step 8: Navigate to your document. Select 'Create a new mapping profile.' and give it a new name. Keep going until the Disbursement Mapping page opens. | Expected: Page displays || Step 9: In the 'Data begins in row number' field select 2. Pick the correct Hard/Soft Option. The fields above should be mapped to the correct column number. | Expected: Setups will be correct. Attachment is an example. || Step 10: Select Next to get the Validation page. If it is valid select 'Import Disbursement' button at the bottom. Job will process. | Expected: All the disbursements should process. |select disb.IMPORT_NUM as Import ,disb.MATTER_UNO ,disb.CURRENCY_CODE as Currency ,disb.BASE_AMT ,disb.COST_CODE ,task.PHTASK_CODE ,disb.DI_OFFC,per.EMPLOYEE_CODE as Emp_Code ,per.EMPLOYEE_NAME as Emp,per2.EMPLOYEE_CODE as Auth_Emp_Code ,per2.EMPLOYEE_NAME as Auth_Emp,disb.DISB_REF ,txt.TXT1 as Narrative ,txt2.TXT1 as Prebill,disb.TRAN_DATE ,disb.BASE_QTY ,disb. BILL_QTY ,disb.TOBILL_AMT,disb.HOLD_DATE ,disb.LOCATION_CODE ,disb.PROJ ,disb.EI_IDfrom cdt_disb disb ,HBM_PERSNL per ,HBM_PERSNL per2 ,TBL_PHTASK task ,CDT_TEXT txt ,CDT_TEXT txt2where disb.DISB_UNO > 3567 and disb.DISB_UNO < 3578and disb.DI_EMPL_UNO = per.EMPL_UNO and disb.AU_EMPL_UNO = per2.EMPL_UNO and disb.PHTASK_UNO = task.PHTASK_UNOand disb.NAR_TEXT_ID = txt.TEXT_ID and disb.PB_TEXT_ID= txt2.TEXT_IDorder by disb.DISB_UNOIf bad data was put in, it will still put the data in the database but when you open the disbursement it will tell you that you need to fix the required field.

Title: Session entry form - Form behaviour
Steps: Step 1: Ribbon Bar : || Step 2: Session Group:Save:Close:Release:Unrelease:Post:Delete: | Expected: All 6 buttons on the left should exist in session entry screen. Enable/disable status please see the detailed test case for each area. || Step 3: Disbursement Group:New:Open:Delete: | Expected: All 3 button on the left are dealing with the disbursements within a session.Enable/Disable status please see the detailed test case for each area. || Step 4: Field Behaviours: || Step 5: Session ID: | Expected: Read only, Show 'New Session' when creating a session. Show 'SessionID' after saving. || Step 6: Date:select MAX_DATE,MIN_DATE,* from CDM_PARMS | Expected: - Optional and defaults to today's date.- Only date between MAX_DATE and MIN_DATE inclusive can be selected pre-posting || Step 7: Employee: | Expected: - Optional and no default || Step 8: Office: | Expected: - Optional and No default || Step 9: Disb Category: | Expected: - Required- Selecting of 'Hard' or 'Soft' from the dropdown || Step 10: Disb Type:If Hard:select*from CDL_COST where ALLOW_HARD ='Y' and INACTIVE = 'N'If Soft:select*from CDL_COST where ALLOW_SOFT ='Y' and INACTIVE = 'N' | Expected: - Optional and no default-Dropdown should show and only show all the cost code returned in the query-Dropdown should show and only show all the cost code returned in the query || Step 11: Status Hover:Unposted:SELECTSTATUS,*FROM CDS_DISB_Z WHERESTATUS='E'orSTATUS='R'Posted:SELECT STATUS, * FROM CDS_DISB_Z WHERE STATUS = 'P' | Expected: - Orange(U) for unposted- Green (P) for postedFor both posted and unposted will include following information on hover:StatusAudit PrintedCreated ByCreated OnChanged ByChanged OnSource

Title: Smoke Test Disb: Merge - Basic Merge
Description: This is to test merging two disbursements.
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqDisb 1 $200 and Disb 2 $250- Same Currency - USD- Same Client.Matter- Same Disbursement Code- Both Posted *Make sure you do not have any other disbursements in DB that will get merge along, cancel them if exist.select*from CDT_DISB where MATTER_UNO ='100367'and WIP_STATUS ='W'CDH_SUMMARY_GL Record last modified and amount values for your disb code / matter combo TBH_MATTER_SUMMARY SELECT * FROM TBH_MATTER_SUMM WHERE MATTER_UNO = (Matter on disbursements)* Record LAST_MODIFIED, BILLED_HARD, BILLED_SOFT, HARD_COUNT, SOFT_COUNT || Step 2: Search for Disbursements to Merge- Enter Client.Matter- Search, should return the disbursements preview. | Expected: Merge PreviewDisb Code, Currency = USD To Bill Amount Total = $450Record Count = 2 || Step 3: Merge Disbursements- Enter Required Fields (Values don't matter)- Click Merge | Expected: Grid display Disb 1 and Disb 2 * Status = Cancelled (X)* Base Amount = 0* To Bill Amount = 0 Disb 3 (new disb)* Client/Matter = Same as Pre-Req* Source Type = Disbursement Merge (ME)* Disb Code = Same as Pre-Req* Status = WIP* Base Amount = 450* To Bill Amount = 450 In Database Disb 1 and Disb 2 CDT_DISB* BASE_AMT= $0* TOBILL_AMT= $0* ACTIVITY_COUNT = 1* SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = CDN (it is empty, tested in 823.EX08) (in 824.1 - it is 'CDN')* WIP_STATUS = X* COST_CODE = Same as Pre-Req CDT_DISB_MOD* COST_CODE = Same as Pre-Req* BASE_AMT_VAR = -200 and -250* TOBILL_AMT_VAR = -200 and -250* STD_AMT_VAR = -200 and -250 --Vinod : For me getting it as 0.. Disb 3 (Merged Disbursement) CDT_DISB* BASE_AMOUNT = $450* TOBILL_AMOUNT = $450* ACTIVITY_COUNT = 1* SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = ME* WIP_STATUS = W* COST_CODE = Same as Pre-ReqCDT_DISB_MOD* SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = ME* COST_CODE = Same as Disb1 and Disb2* BASE_AMT_VAR = 450* TOBILL_AMT_VAR = 450* STD_AMT_VAR = 450 ----Vinod : For me getting it as 0.. * Type = D Summary Tables CDH_SUMMARY_GL Your cost code should appear in here as the last modifiedThere should be no net change in amount values.  TBH_MATTER_SUMMARY SELECT * FROM TBH_MATTER_SUMM WHERE MATTER_UNO = (Matter on disbursements)* LAST_MODIFIED = updated, * no change in amount values, * HARD/SOFT count +1 || Step 4: Attempt to merge when no disbursements available to merge: Vinod: Merge is not allowing when no disbursments- Click Merge on the ribbon, complete the required fields, make sure it is a client/matter with nothing to merge- Merge without clicking search. | Expected: Merge completed with message, only seen in Recent Activity: "Based on the selected items and the grouping criteria, no entries were able to be merged. No new entries have been created."

Title: Merge - Merge with Multiple Disb Types
Description: This is for merging multiple disbursements and multiple disbursement types.
Steps: Step 1: Pre req per test2 disbursements for Disb Code 1, $100 and $2002 disbursements for Disb Code 2, $300 and $400 **Dibursements should be identical other than Disb Code and Amounts || Step 2: Merge without Group By (except the required fields) | Expected: Merged into 2 new disbs. One with Disb Code 1, Another with Disb Code 2. Base and Bill Amount is total of merged disbursements. Disb Code 1 = $300, Disb Code 2 = $700Four pre-merge disbs are cancelled, their Base and Bill Amount is set to Zero.

It will be 'X'.

Title: Cancel Disb - Ribbon button availability
Steps: Step 1: Filter so that the returned disb is Created in Expert = Yes and Source Type = CDN || Step 2: Single Select- Select disb in Edit- Select disb in Released- Select disb in WIP- Select disb in Prebill- Select disb in Bill | Expected: - Disb in Edit, button disabled- Disb in Released, button disabled- Disb in WIP, button enabled- Disb in Prebill, button disabled- Disb in Bill, button disabled || Step 3: Multi Select- All selected disbs in Edit- All select disb in WIP- Some selected disbs are in Edit and some are WIP | Expected: - All disbs are not in WIP, button disabled- All disbs are in WIP, button enabled.- Some disbs are not in WIP, button disabled.

Title: Expert Disb: Split Once: Disbursement: Percentage: System Currency NEED BETTER VERIFICATION
Steps: Step 1: Create a Disbursement that is based on Amount and with system currency || Step 2: Post Disbursement || Step 3: On the Disbursement Tab find the disbursement and select the Split button. | Expected: Split Screen will display. || Step 4: Split the disbursement into one other disbursements based on percentage and select the 'Split' button. | Expected: Job will run and the disbursement will split. || Step 5: Review the Disbursement Tab | Expected: New Disbursement created and it will be in the same session as the original. Original will have the new value.

Title: Disbursements Status
Steps: Step 1: Launch Expert Disbursements || Step 2: Create a new disbursement. | Expected: EXPERT_DISB_STATUS = Eselect EXPERT_DISB_STATUS from cdt_disb order by DISB_UNO desc || Step 3: Release the Disbursement. | Expected: EXPERT_DISB_STATUS = Rselect EXPERT_DISB_STATUS from cdt_disb order by DISB_UNO desc || Step 4: Post the Disbursement | Expected: EXPERT_DISB_STATUS = Wselect EXPERT_DISB_STATUS from cdt_disb order by DISB_UNO desc || Step 5: Attach the disbursement to a prebill (Through Expert Billing Application) | Expected: EXPERT_DISB_STATUS = Pselect EXPERT_DISB_STATUS from cdt_disb order by DISB_UNO desc || Step 6: Post the bill (Through Expert Billing Application) | Expected: EXPERT_DISB_STATUS = Bselect EXPERT_DISB_STATUS from cdt_disb order by DISB_UNO desc || Step 7: Cancel the Posted Disbursement | Expected: EXPERT_DISB_STATUS = Xselect EXPERT_DISB_STATUS from cdt_disb order by DISB_UNO desc

Title: Post Disb - Anticipated Disb
Steps: Step 1: Pre req Disbursement Code- Auto Match on Anticipate Item, NO THRESHOLD || Step 2: Matching anticpated Disbursement1. Create disb in Expert Disb. Amount and Disb Code used is same with anticipated disbursement.2. Post the disb.3. Check if disb is matched with anticipated disb. | Expected: Record MatchedCDT_DISB- Record from Step 3 update WIP_STATUS = 'W' with PERIOD, LATEST_PERIOD and DRUNO populated.- Another identical record created with Negative TOBILL_AMT to balance the anticipated disbursement that has been billed. It is a posted record with WIP_STATUS = 'W', Periods and Drunos populated. CDT_DISB_ANTIC- Original record from Billing updated STATUS = 'M' (Matched)- New record created with Status = 'F' (Final Matching Disbursement) with Negative DISB_AMT, MATCH_AMT and MATCH_DISB_UNO populated from Original Antic record in BIlling.  CDT_DISB_NEW- Two new records created. One for posted disb and another to balance the billed amount (BILL_AMT).*Bug 208324 Wrong CDT_DISB_NEW.Type when automatic matching anticipated disbursements- Type = N for entered disbursement in Expert disb- Type = M for record with negative tobill_amt  CDH_SUMMARY_GL- BASE_NEW and TOBILL_NEW (no changes in value as it has balanced out) updated TBH_MATTER_SUMM- HARD/SOFT_TOTAL updated Locate the matched records on Disb grid || Step 3: Create another bill for the Client.Matter. | Expected: The matched disbursement is balanced out and not billed to the client.

Title: Post Disb - Anticipated Disb - Hard/Soft
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqAnticipated Disb Code with No matching tresholdClassic > Client Disb > Disb Setup > Disb Code > Anticipate Items > Auto Match, Match Treshold = 0 || Step 2: Enter a Hard Anticipated Disbursement in Classic Billing as Shared Step below || Step 3: Attempt to match the Hard Anticipated Disbursement with Soft Disbursement.1. Create Soft disb in Expert Disb. Amount and Disb Code used is same with anticipated disbursement.2. Post the Soft disb.3. Check if Soft  disb is matched with Hard anticipated disb. | Expected: Disbs are not matchedThe Hard  anticipated disb record CDT_DISB_ANTIC.Status remain as 'N'Soft disb Base and Bill Amount are not write off.

Title: Post Disb - Anticipated Disb - with Threshold
Steps: Step 1: Pre req Disbursement Code- Auto Match with 10% Treshold on Anticipate Item- Antic disb Bill Amount = $100 || Step 2: Disbursement BIll Amount = $90. Post. | Expected: Not matched. 10% of $90 = 9. Hence matching Antic disb between 81 (90-9) to 99 (90+9), Antic disb Bill Amount = 100 is not in range. || Step 3: Disbursement Bill Amount = 110 | Expected: Matched.10% of $110 = 11. Hence matching Antic disb between 99 (110-11) to 121 (110+11). || Step 4: Disbursement Bill Amount = 90.91 | Expected: Matched.10% of $90.91 = 9.09. Hence matching Antic disb between 81.82 (90.91 - 9.09) to 100 (90.91+9.09) || Step 5: Disbursement Bill Amount = 111.11 | Expected: Matched.10% of $111.11 = 11.11. Hence matching Antic disb between 100(111.11 -11.11) to 122.22 (+11.11)

Title: Expert Disb: Anticipated Disb: Automatch in Session
Steps: Step 1: In the following steps create an Automatch without a threshold. || Step 2: In Expert Disbursements create a session. | Expected: Session needs to have the same Hard/Soft type as Disbursement Type. || Step 3: In the session, create a disbursement with the same Client/Matter/Disbursement Type/Amount as the one created in classic. || Step 4: Post the disbursement. | Expected: It will automatch.

Title: Expert Disb: Anticipated Disb: Automatch Threshold
Steps: Step 1: In the following steps create an Automatch with a 10% threshold. || Step 2: Create a disbursement with the same Client/Matter/Disbursement Type with the Amount over 10% of the one created in classic. | Expected: Example: If the Disbursement is $100, put it as $111. || Step 3: Post the disbursement. | Expected: It will not automatch. || Step 4: Create a disbursement with the same Client/Matter/Disbursement Type with the Amount equal to 10% of the one created in classic. | Expected: Example: If the Disbursement is $100, put it as $110. || Step 5: Post the disbursement. | Expected: It will automatch.

Title: Undo Split - Multicurrency Disbursement
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqA posted CAD 150 disbursement. | Expected: Posted disbursement amount saved as 137.3616582080 || Step 2: UndoSplit twice on the CAD Disbursement then Undo it*every split must be more than 0% to different matter | Expected: The amount at the end of undo split matched the amount before split

Title: Undo Split - Mass Undo
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqCreate three disbursements. Do a split on each of them. || Step 2: Mass Undo Split - Enter criteria so search returns all original splitted disb. - Ensure they are OK to split.- Multi Select two of them on the Original Pre-Split Entries grid.- Click Undo Split | Expected: Only selected ones are undo-ed

Title: Undo Split - Multiple Splits

Title: Edit List - Session - Print Edit List for each disbursement

Title: Disbursements - Locked state and expired locks
Steps: Step 1: Open the Disbursement with a different user1. Open the disbursement with user1(ie. Your user)2. Open the disbursement with user2(ie. ttqa1)3. Close the disbursement copy opened with user2 | Expected: * guid lock is applied for user 1* lock remains with user 1 * Disbursement displays as disabled for user 2* lock alert displays in yellow alert bar for user 2 SELECT * FROM CMS_LOCK || Step 2: Open the Disbursement with the same user as locked by | Expected: * guid lock is applied * lock remains when opened in second session* Disbursement displays as enabled* lock is removed when record in second session is closed || Step 3: Run a job when record locked by the different user | Expected: * guid application lock is applied* job has a failure processing the record* application lock remains || Step 4: Run a job when record has expired lock | Expected: * Expired lock is removed* New job lock applied Note: As the job process is quick, there is no time to check that the lock occurred so need to check using sql profilter: search for: sp_cmsmakelockcio || Step 5: Open a disbursement has expired lock | Expected: * Expired lock is removed* New application lock applied

Title: Session Lock - Lock state and expired locks
Steps: Step 1: Open the Session with a different user1. Open Session with user1 (ie. your user)2. Open Session with user2 (ie. TTQA1)3. Close Session opened by user2 | Expected: * guid lock is applied for user 1* lock remains with user 1 * session header displays as disabled for user 2* lock alert displays in yellow alert bar for user 2 SELECT * FROM CMS_LOCK || Step 2: Open the Session with same user as locked by1. Open the Session with user 12. Open the Session with user 1 in another session3. Close the Session opened by user 1 in second session | Expected: * guid lock is applied * lock remains when opened in second session* session displays as enabled* lock is removed when record in second session is closed || Step 3: Run a job against the Session | Expected: * Application lock applied on the Session while job processed. Lock release after the job done.* Job lock grant on each of the disbursement, not on session.Note: As the job process is quick, there is no time to check that the lock occurred so need to check using sql profilter: search for: sp_cmsmakelockcio

Title: Job - Locking behaviors on a job lock
Description:
Job locking should be grant when job is running and release when job is done. 
20 mins expire time is set for a normal job.
Use sql trace to catch the job lock.

Title: Expert Disb: Ctrl + F9
Description: Ctrl +  F9 functionality should copy all the fields from the previous disbursement created. This will only work if you used 'Save & Add' functionality.
Steps: Step 1: In the Disbursement Tab select the 'New' button. | Expected: New Disbursement screen will open. || Step 2: Add in all the required fields as well as a Base Amount. Select 'Save & Add' | Expected: Data will save and clear from the form. || Step 3: Select Ctrl+F9. | Expected: Data from previous Disbursement will display. || Step 4: Make some changes and select Save & Close. | Expected: Data will save and screen will close. || Step 5: Review both of the Disbursements created to ensure the data that was saved is still in the Disbursement. | Expected: Data will be correct.

Title: Expert Disb: Ctrl + Shift + F9
Description: Ctrl + Shift + F9 functionality should copy only the field you are in from the previous disbursement created. This will only work if you used 'Save & Add' functionality.
Steps: Step 1: In the Disbursement Tab select the 'New' button. | Expected: New Disbursement screen will open. || Step 2: Add in all the required fields as well as a Base Amount. Select 'Save & Add' | Expected: Data will save and clear from the form. || Step 3: Select Ctrl+Shft+F9. | Expected: Nothing will happen since the cursor will be in the date field. || Step 4: Click into the 'Client/Matter' field and Select Ctrl+Shft+F9. | Expected: Data for that field will populate with the same client/matter from the previous disbursement. No other fields will populate. || Step 5: Fill out the rest of the Disbursement and select Save & Close. | Expected: Data will save and screen will close. || Step 6: Review both of the Disbursements created to ensure the data that was saved is still in the Disbursement. | Expected: Data will be correct.

Title: Smoke Test Disb: Disbursements
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqTurn on Firm Options |  Allow Currency Override(Expert Admin ->Disbursements ->Disbursements Options -> Firm Options) Setup Disbursement Code as below :Disb Type A (e.g. COUR)- No unit rate Disb Type B (e.g. FAX)- With unit rate : USD $1 The two DISB types are set up in Expert Admin, then apply the unit rate via Appshell (in Classic)Note: if Disb Code do not have unit rate, the disb currency will default from Office. If Disb Code have unit rate, disb currency will based on Firm Options | Currency | Base Currency, which usually set to Matter Currency. | Expected: Setup Disb Code- Expert Admin > Disbursements > Disb Options > Disb Types- Can only setup Unit Rate in Classic > Client Disb >Disb Setup > Disb Types (As in version 821) || Step 2: Create, Save and Close1. Enter New Disbursement with Disb Type A USD$100.2. Change the Bill Amount to USD$150.3. Save and Close. | Expected: Disb saved Status = Edit. Bill Amount default from Base Amount. Re-enter Bill Amount do not change Base Amount.Amounts should display in disbursement currency in grid. || Step 3: Open and Edit1. Open and change Disbursment Code to Disb Type B.2. Enter Quantity = 50.3.  Save and Close. | Expected: 2. Base and Bill Amount reset to Zero. Auto Calculation flag is checked.3. Base and Bill Amount is now USD$50. || Step 4: Create Edit List Report | Expected: Report is created Bug 261661 - Edit reports hang in AP and Disbursement apps || Step 5: Release and Unrelease1. Release disbursement.2. Unrelease disbursement. | Expected: 1. Disbursement status = Released.2. Disbursement status = Edit. || Step 6: Post and Edit1. Post disbursement.2. Edit disbursement using Edit ribbon button. Change the Client.Matter. Fill in the required fields, save and closed. | Expected: 1. Disbursement status = WIP.2. Verify that it is creating two mod rows for the edit. select * from CDT_DISB_MOD where DISB_UNO = @disbUno. 1 for previous matter with negative BASE_AMT_VAR and TOBILL_AMT_VAR, 1 for current matter with positive BASE_AMT_VAR and TOBILL_AMT_VAR- Verify the change is reflected on the grid. || Step 7: Mass Edit1. Create another disbursement with Disb Type A. Post it2. Select disbursement on the list and click Mass Edit. 3. Change the Cost Code. Fill in the required fields, save and closed. | Expected: 1. Verify again if it is creating two mod rows for the edit. select * from CDT_DISB_MOD where DISB_UNO = @disbUno. 1 for previous matter with negative BASE_AMT_VAR and TOBILL_AMT_VAR, 1 for current matter with positive BASE_AMT_VAR and TOBILL_AMT_VAR3. Verify the change is reflected on the grid. || Step 8: Split 1. Create another disbursement with Disb Type B and Quantity = 100, Base and Bill Amount = C$50. Post it2. Select the disbursement from the list and Split.3. Split on : Quantity.4. Split 30% and 20% to other Matter.Note: In 821, bill quantity will not be populated by split. 201144Bug 242352: Search disbs with Client and Tran Date filter then perform split/unsplit will trigger an error when updating grid. | Expected: Two new disbursements created from the split. Source disbursement and target disbursements have same split number.Target disbursements Quantity and Amounts are splitted 30% and 20%. Target disb 1, Quantity = 30, Base and Bill Amount = C$15.Target disb 2, Quantity = 20, Base and Bill Amount = C$10.Leftover 50% remains with Source Disbursements, Quantity = 50, Base and Bill Amount = C$25. || Step 9: Undo Split 1. Select the splitted disbursement, click Undo Split.2. Fill in the required fields then Undo Split. | Expected: Split is undone Three disbs showing under Split Entries for Disb ID # smartgrid.Two target disbursements are canceled. Source disbursement now have the original Quantity = 100 and Amount = C$50. || Step 10: Cancel1. Fill in the required fields then Cancel. | Expected: Disbusement is canceledDisbursement status = Cancelled. || Step 11: Cancel an invoice with Split/ Unsplit  Disb Items (use Expert AP & Expert Disb apps)Pre-requisite: create an invoice in Expert AP using the appropriate Disbursement Code. Once completed, proceed to Expert Disbursement to perform both the split and unsplit actions on the same disbursement. | Expected: Cancelling an invoice with disbursement split / Unsplit i-e cancelled disbursement, does not result in the generation of extra APX WIP entries in CDT_DISB_MOD.Bug 270149: BUG: Invoice with disbursement split in Expert Disbursement generates extra APX WIP (fixed in 8250)

Title: Smoke Test Disb: Disbursements Sessions
Steps: Step 1: Create new Sessions1. In Sessions tab, create new Session.2. Fill in all the fields on the header. | Expected: Hard/Soft is required on the header. || Step 2: Add new Disbursements and Edit them inline1. Create two new disbursements.2. Edit them via Inline Edit3. Open and view, verify change is reflected on screen. | Expected: Disbursements open up on Disbursement Card.Changes made via inline edit should reflect on disb card and vice versa. || Step 3: Release Session | Expected: All disbursements under the sessions should be in Release stateVerify select*from CDT_DISB where SESSION= @sessionID || Step 4: Unrelease Session | Expected: All disbursements under the sessions should be Edit state.Verify select*from CDT_DISB where SESSION= @sessionID || Step 5: Delete Session | Expected: All disbursements under the sessions should be deleted. Verify select*from CDT_DISB where SESSION= @sessionID || Step 6: Post Session1. Recreate the two disbursements.2. Post Session. | Expected: Session is in Posted state.All disbursements under the sessions should be in WIP state.Verify select*from CDT_DISB where SESSION= @sessionID || Step 7: Print Edit List (Required SSRS installed) | Expected: Verify the report have all the disbursements under the session.

Title: Split Disb - Basic Split
Steps: Step 1: Pre req1 Matter as the Source of the split.1 Matter as the Target of the split. | Expected: *CDT_DISB.ACTIVITY_COUNT should be updated and is equal to the number of rows on CDT_DISB_MOD for the disbursement. Source Disbursement = Disbursement which will be split.Source Matter = The matter on Source Disbursement. Target Disbursement = Disbursement which will be created after the split is performed.Target Matter = The matter on Target Disbursement. || Step 2: # 1 Split 100% to Target Matter1. Create an disb with USD100.2. Post it.3. Split with percentage field -100% to target matter. | Expected: Whole amount of source disb is now splitted to target disb. Both disbs still in WIP status.Source Disb Bill and ToBill Amount = $0.Target Disb Bill and ToBill Amount = $100. CDT_DISB.TRANSFERRED = S and SPLIT_NUM populated.CDH_SUMMARY_GL and TBH_MATTER_SUMM for source and target matter updated. Two rows of CDT_DISB_MOD created :1 for source matter, TYPE = O, BASE && TOBILL && STD_AMT_VAR = -$100.1 for target matter, TYPE = I, BASE && TOBILL && STD_AMT_VAR = $100. || Step 3: #2 Split 40% to Target Matter1. Create an disb with USD100.2. Post it.3. Split with percentage field - 40% target matter. | Expected: 40% ($40) amount of source disb is now splitted to one target disbs. All disbs still in WIP status.Source Disb with Source Matter, Base and ToBill Amount = $60. CDT_DISB.TRANSFERRED = N and SPLIT_NUM populated.Target Disb with Target Matter, Base and ToBill Amount = $40. CDT_DISB.TRANSFERRED = S and SPLIT_NUM populated. CDH_SUMMARY_GL and TBH_MATTER_SUMM for source and target matter updated. Two rows of CDT_DISB_MOD created :1 for source matter, TYPE = O, BASE && TOBILL && STD_AMT_VAR = -$40.1 for target matter, TYPE = I, BASE && TOBILL && STD_AMT_VAR = $40. || Step 4: #3 Split 60% Source Matter, 40% Target Matter - No Remainder1. Create an disb with USD100.2. Post it.3. Split with percentage field - 60% source matter, 40% target matter. Note that we are creating another split line back to source matter. | Expected: Whole amount of source is now splitted to two target disbs, 1 with Source Matter and another with Target Matter. All disbs still in WIP status.Original Disb with Source Matter, Base and ToBill Amount = $0. CDT_DISB.TRANSFERRED = N and SPLIT_NUM populated.Target Disb with Target Matter, Base and ToBill Amount = $40. CDT_DISB.TRANSFERRED = S and SPLIT_NUM populated.Target Disb with Source Matter, Base and ToBill Amount = $60. CDT_DISB.TRANSFERRED = S and SPLIT_NUM populated. CDH_SUMMARY_GL and TBH_MATTER_SUMM for source and target matter updated. Three rows of CDT_DISB_MOD created :1 for source matter, TYPE = O, BASE && TOBILL && STD_AMT_VAR = -$100.1 for source matter, TYPE = I, BASE && TOBILL && STD_AMT_VAR = $60.1 for target matter, TYPE = I, BASE && TOBILL && STD_AMT_VAR = $40.

Title: Split Disb - Auto and Delayed Split - Multi Currency
Steps: Step 1: Pre req1 Matter as the Source of the split.1 Matter as the Target A of the split.1 Matter as the Target B of the split Setup Auto Split AppShell > Matter Management > Auto Time and Disb Splits Source Matter to Auto Split into :Target Matter A - 30%Target Matter B - 50% Setup Delayed Split Only available in Expert Entity Manager.Entity Manager > Matters > Auto Time and Disb Splits > Enable Delayed Split checkbox. Entity Manager>Time and Billing>disbursement>Enable Auto disbursement split checkboxSource Matter to Auto Split into :Target Matter A - 40%Target Matter B - 60%*Delayed Split do not allow any remainder percentage on Source Matter. All Split Percentage should be fully allocated. | Expected: *CDT_DISB.ACTIVITY_COUNT should be updated and is equal to the number of rows on CDT_DISB_MOD for the disbursement. CAD,  RATE = 1.092007784100000 , RECIPROCAL = 0.915744388053213 Source Disbursement = Disbursement which will be split.Source Matter = The matter on Source Disbursement. Target Disbursement = Disbursement which will be created after the split is performed.Target Matter = The matter on Target Disbursement. || Step 2: #4 Auto Split1. Create an disb with CAD100 with Auto Split matter.2. Post it. | Expected: Split happens automatically after disbursement is posted. Two target disbursements created.All disbs still in WIP status.Source Disb Bill and ToBill Amount = $18.3148877611.Target Disb Matter A Base and ToBill Amount = (30%) $27.4723316416. Title: Split Disb - Split to Matter with different Currency
Steps: Step 1: Pre req1 USD Matter as the Source of the split.1 CAD Matter as the Target of the split. Set Standard Disbursement Currency to look at Matter Currency.CDM_PARMS.STD_DISB_CURR = MA 1 Disb Code with Unit Rate flag Checked1 Disb Code with Unit Rate flag Unchecked | Expected: *CDT_DISB.ACTIVITY_COUNT should be updated and is equal to the number of rows on CDT_DISB_MOD for the disbursement. Source Disbursement = Disbursement which will be split.Source Matter = The matter on Source Disbursement. Target Disbursement = Disbursement which will be created after the split is performed.Target Matter = The matter on Target Disbursement. || Step 2: #16 Split 40% to Target Matter, Disb Code Unit Rate flag CHECKED1. Create a USD disbursement with USD Matter using disb code Unit Rate flag Checked. Enter a Quantity.2. Post it. 3. Split 40% to CAD Target Matter. | Expected: Split should not be possible. Classic doesn't split. It is looking at the BASE and STANDARD Currency of Source and Target Matter. They do not split if the TBM_MATTER currency is not match. Currently can split due to the validation in not included in Expert. Bug 201568 Split Disb - Include the validation of standard currency not matching between source and destination matters before split || Step 3: #17 Split 40% to Target Matter, Disb Code Unit Rate flag UNCHECKED - USD TO CAD1. Create a USD disbursement with USD Matter using disb code Unit Rate flag Unchecked. Enter a Quantity.2. Post it. 3. Split 40% to CAD Target Matter. | Expected: Can split. On this use case, it looks at disbursement office currency of the Source and Target disbursement Office Currency. No Unit Rate hence no Standard Currency involved. As long as the Office is the same for both Matter, they will have the same currency given that each office can only have one currency.. The Bill_Qty is also not populated correctly on Target Disbursement. Bug 201144 Split - Disb created from split do not have Bill Quantity populated. || Step 4: Split 40% to Target Matter, Disb Code Unit Rate flag UNCHECKED - CAD TO USD1. Create a CAD disbursement with CAD Matter using disb code Unit Rate flag Unchecked. Enter a Quantity.2. Post it. 3. Split 40% to USD Target Matter. | Expected: Can split.Currency of Target and Source disbursement remain as CAD, Amount fields are in system currency.  Bug 201168 Split - Standard amount of disbursement created from split only has two decimal points.

Title: Smoke Test Disb: Customisation
Steps: Step 1: \\VMCRT8210WS301, \\VMCRT8220WS301 :Column: _FINDISB_TEXTSmartform Field: Custom Text | Expected: Note: On this environment another team has done a customization- adding _PRIORITY_UNO. We need to set this to 1 or 2 otherwise the app crashes. Have made a change to the Smart Form to add this field in but have not yet done it for the Merge so it will cause merging a disb to 'not save' (but it does) and subsequent attempts to access the merged disb will cause the app to crash. Updating the priority uno to 1 or 2 will stop this happening. || Step 2: Customise CDT_DISB.Add a custom column to CDT_DISB. Expose this column on Disbursement Card, filters and grid.Apply the customisation || Step 3: After applying the customisation, verify the whole disbursement process and ensure no issue found and the Status is updating : || Step 4: Create disb | Expected: a new row in cdt_disb with WIP_STATUS = 'N' and EXPERT_DISB_STATUS = 'E' || Step 5: Release disb | Expected: EXPERT_DISB_STATUS = 'R' || Step 6: Unrelease disb | Expected: EXPERT_DISB_STATUS = 'E' || Step 7: Post disb | Expected: both WIP_STATUS and EXPERT_DISB_STATUS = 'W' || Step 8: Edit Posted disb | Expected: The change is persisted to the correct row || Step 9: Mass Edit Posted disb | Expected: The change is persisted to the correct row || Step 10: Split Disb | Expected: New rows are generated in cdt_disb, same split number is populated in the rows, ADJ_CODE and ADJ_AU_EMPL_UNO populated in the original || Step 11: Undo Split Disb | Expected: The split disb has WIP_STATUS and EXPERT_DISB_STATUS both set to 'X' || Step 12: Merge Disb | Expected: All the merged disb has both WIP_STATUS and EXPERT_DISB_STATUS set to 'X', a new row is created - custom data is lost as the SP is not customised || Step 13: Cancel Posted Disb | Expected: WIP_STATUS and EXPERT_DISB_STATUS both set to 'X' || Step 14: Create Session with disb | Expected: New disb has the same session number || Step 15: Release/Unrelease session with disb | Expected: All disb in the session has EXPERT_DISB_STATUS set to 'R' on release, to 'E' on unrelease || Step 16: Post session with disb | Expected: All disb in the session has both WIP_STATUS and EXPERT_DISB_STATUS set to 'W'
