Title: Merge - Merge with Disb Code with different Hard/Soft value
Description: This is to test merging two disbursements.
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqDisb Code and Client.Matter must allow both Soft and Hard disb.1 HARD disb $200, 1 SOFT disb $200- Same Currency - Same Client.Matter- Same Disbursement Code = MERGE*Make sure you do not have any other disbursements in DB that will get merge along, cancel them if exist.select * from CDT_DISB where MATTER_UNO ='100367'and WIP_STATUS ='W' || Step 2: Merge Disb- Enter Client.Matter- Search, should return the disbursements preview.- Merge | Expected: Merge Preview :- Disb Code = MERGE, Currency = USD, To Bill Amount Total = $400, Record Count = 2Disbs NOT MergedJob Completed with message - 'Based on the selected items and the grouping criteria, no entries were able to be merged. No new entries have been created'

Title: Merge - Merge with Billable/Non-billable
Description: This is to test merging two disbursements.
Steps: Step 1: Pre req1 Billable disb $200, 1 Non-bill disb $200- Same Currency - Same Client.Matter- Same Disbursement Code = MERGE *Make sure you do not have any other disbursements in DB that will get merge along, cancel them if exist.select * from CDT_DISB where MATTER_UNO ='100367'and WIP_STATUS ='W' || Step 2: 1 Billable disb $200, 1 Non-bill disb $200Using Billable Matter, create 1 billable disb $200Set the same Matter to Non-billableCreate 1 non-billable disb $200.Matters can be found in Expert Entity | Matters | Select a Matter | Time And Billing | Disbursement || Step 3: Merge Disb- Enter Client.Matter- Search, should return the disbursements preview.- Merge | Expected: Merge Preview :- Disb Code = MERGE, Currency = USD, To Bill Amount Total = $400, Record Count = 2 Disbs NOT MergedJob Completed with message - 'Based on the selected items and the grouping criteria, no entries were able to be merged. No new entries have been created'

Title: Merge - Merge with different Source Type
Description: This is to test merging two disbursements.
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqDisb Code and Client.Matter must allow both Soft and Hard disb. Create Disb for each Source Type, they should be same matter, currency, amount and hard/soft value. *Make sure you do not have any other disbursements in DB that will get merge along, cancel them if exist.select * from CDT_DISB where MATTER_UNO ='100367'and WIP_STATUS ='W' || Step 2: Merge Disbursement - with Invoice AP Disbursement  In Expert Accounts Payable- Attach a disbursement detail line in Accounts Payable - Invoice- Post this Invoice (Disbursement detail line must match Invoice amount) In Expert Disbursements- In Expert Disbursement Merge screen, Filter on Client Matter where Client/Matter is equal to the values on the Disbursements.- Search (Record Count should be 1)- Set a Phase Task and Disbursement Date- Merge | Expected: Merge Preview :- Should be Disb Code = MERGE, Currency = USD, To Bill Amount Total = $200, Record Count = 1*Bug 209034 Merge - Merge Preview to filter out record with non-zero source_tran_uno and with matched anticipated cost.  Disbs NOT MergedJob Completed with message - 'Based on the selected items and the grouping criteria, no entries were able to be merged. No new entries have been created' || Step 3: Merge Disb - with Check CH DisbIn Expert Accounts Payable- Create a Vendor Payment with Payment Method set to Manual (you will need a valid Check Number)- Enter a disbursement detail line in Accounts Payable - Payments- Post this Payment (Disbursement detail line must match Payment amount)In Expert Disbursements- In Expert Disbursement Merge screen, Filter on Client Matter where Client/Matter is equal to the values on the Disbursements.- Search (Record Count should be 1)- Set a Phase Task and Disbursement Date- Merge | Expected: Merge Preview :- Should be Disb Code = MERGE, Currency = USD, To Bill Amount Total = $200, Record Count = 1*Bug 209034 Merge - Merge Preview to filter out record with non-zero source_tran_uno and with matched anticipated cost.  Disbs NOT MergedJob Completed with message - 'Based on the selected items and the grouping criteria, no entries were able to be merged. No new entries have been created' || Step 4: Merge Disb - with Merge ME Disb In Expert Disbursements create a Disbursement with Source Type (ME)- Create 2 disbursements with the same details. - Post these disbursements.- In Expert Disbursement Merge screen, Filter on Client Matter where Client/Matter is equal to the values on the Disbursements.- Search (Record Count should be 2).- Set a Phase Task and Disbursement Date. - Merge them, should merge to a new disbursement with a Source Type of Disbursement Merge (ME) and a Status of WIP (W). The two previous disbursements used in the merge should have a status of Cancelled (X)  In Expert Disbursements create a Disbursement with Source Type (CDN)- Create another disbursement.- Post this new disbursement.- In Expert Disbursement Merge screen, Filter on Client Matter where Client/Matter is equal to the values on the Disbursements.- Search (Record Count should be 2).- Set a Phase Task and Disbursement Date.- Merge. | Expected: Merge Preview :- Disb Code = MERGE, Currency = USD, To Bill Amount Total = $400, Record Count = 2- All disbursements used for merging should have a status of Cancelled (X).- New merged disbursements should have a status of WIP (W) and a Source Type of Disbursement Merge (ME) Disbursements SHOULD Merge- Amount of the merged disbursement should be equal to the sum of the pre-merge disbursements.- Source Type should be Disbursement Merge (ME).- Status should be WIP (W).- Pre-merge disbursements should have a status of Cancelled (X). || Step 5: Merge Disb - with Employee Expense EE Disb- Enter Disb via Classic Expenses module. - In Expert Disb Merge screen, search, should return the disbursements preview.- Merge | Expected: Merge Preview- Should be Disb Code = MERGE, Currency = USD, To Bill Amount Total = $200, Record Count = 1*Bug 209034 Merge - Merge Preview to filter out record with non-zero source_tran_uno and with matched anticipated cost.  Disbs NOT MergedJob Completed with message - 'Based on the selected items and the grouping criteria, no entries were able to be merged. No new entries have been created' || Step 6: Merge Disb - with Anticipated Disb AD Disb- Enter Anticipated Disb via Classic Billing- In Expert Disb Merge screen, search, should return the disbursements preview.- Merge | Expected: Merge Preview- Shoulf not show up in preview AD Disb will either be in Prebill or Bill state. It cannot be return to WIP, hence not eligible for merge. || Step 7: Merge Disb - with Matched Anticipated Disb- Create Disb and Post. It should have same details have Anticipated Disb in Step 6 so that they matched.- In Expert Disb Merge screen, search, should return the disbursements preview.- Merge | Expected: Merge Preview- Should not show up in preview*Bug 209034 Merge - Merge Preview to filter out record with non-zero source_tran_uno and with matched anticipated cost. || Step 8: Merge Disb - with Imported DI Disb- Enter Client.Matter- In Expert Disb Merge screen, search, should return the disbursements preview.- Merge | Expected: NOT populating DI source type in both Expert and Classic import on CDT_DISB, only CDT_DISB_Z - as in 17/12/18Imported Disb is still CDN type, hence merge-able.

Title: Merge - Merge with only filtered records
Steps: Step 1: Pre req2 disbursements for Disb Code 1- $100 and $1502 disbursements for Disb Code 2- $100 and $150**Dibursements should be identical other than Disb Code, and both should be in WIP state || Step 2: Merge disb for Disb Code 1 only1. On the Merge Disbursement screen, enter Client/Matter and Disb Code 1.2. Search. Should only return disbs for Disb Code 1 in Merge Preview.3. Merge | Expected: Two Disbs for Disb Code 1 is merged. Original entries are cancelled and a new disb with $250 is created for Disb code 1.Two Disbs for Disb Code 2 is not merged and records remain unchanged.*See 182462 on what Merge does in more details.

Title: Merge - Merge with Selected Line in Merge Preview
Steps: Step 1: *Note : In Classic help page stated that you can 'select a single merge possibility to create a disbursement entry for that line only'. But this is not what I observed. It still merge everything that comes back for preview even when one line is selected. Expert is also doing the same thing. || Step 2: Pre req2 disbursements for Disb Code 1- $100 and $1502 disbursements for Disb Code 2- $100 and $150**Disbursements should be identical other than Disb Code, and both should be in WIP state || Step 3: Merge with Selected Line1. On the Merge Disbursement screen, enter Client/Matter.2. Search. Should return disbs for Disb Code 1 and Disb Code 2 in Merge Preview.3. Select Disb Code 1 line. Fill in the rest of required fields.4. Merge | Expected: Even with only Disb Code 1 is selected, disbs for Disb Code 2 will also merge.Each disb code merge into disb of their own. Two new disbs created for each disb code. Previous disb entries are cancelled and merge into new disbs.

Title: Merge - Merge with Disbursement Constraint
Steps: Step 1: Setup Matter Disbursement ConstraintAppshell > Matter Management > Disbursement Constraints Add constraint detail for Disb Code A- Current date- Mark up Amount = $10.01- No Unit Rates Make sure disbursement code do not have the same rate setup as matter constraint || Step 2: Create and Post $100 disbursement with Tran Date = Current Date | Expected: Bill Amount is markup by $10.01 from Base Amount.Base Amount = $100Bill Amount = $110.01 || Step 3: Create and Post $100 disbursement for Tran Date BEFORE Current Date | Expected: No markup applied to Bill AmountBase Amount = $100Bill Amount = $100 || Step 4: Merge with Tran Date = Current Date | Expected: Two posted disbursments are cancelled. Disbursement Constraint do not affect merge resultNew merged disbursement created :Base Amount = $200.00Bill Amount = $210.01Status = WIP (W)Source Type = Disbursement Merge (ME)

Title: Disb Card - Default Currency - Matter Currency and Office, Cost Code without Unit Rate
Steps: Step 1: Base Currency - Determines the currency the system will use to stamp a Base Amount disbursement entry in the disbursement detail tables.Standard Currency - Determines the currency the system will use to stamp a Standard Amount disbursement entry in the disbursement detail tables.Based on sp_cmscdcurr_rtn2sp.sql , all CDN type disb will always default currency from disb incurring office, regardless of the Matter and CDM Parms setup when COST CODE DO NOT HAVE UNIT RATE. || Step 2: Pre req Cost Code without Unit RateAppshell > Client Disbursements > Disbursement Setup > Disbursement Types.Has Unit Rate = NoMatter with different currency :USD MatterAppshell > Matter Management > Time and Billing > Currency > Currency Code = USDCAD MatterAppshell > Matter Management > Time and Billing > Currency > Currency Code = CADDefault Environment Setting on most of multicurrency ITE environments and DACPAC :Disbursement Parms > CurrencyBase Currency - Matter Currency (MA)Standard Currency - System Currency (SC) || Step 3: Cost Code without Unit Rate, USD Matter, USD Office1. Create new disb using cost code without unit rate.2. Enter USD Matter and USD Office | Expected: Currency default to USD || Step 4: Cost Code without Unit Rate, USD Matter, CAD Office1. Create new disb using cost code without unit rate.2. Enter USD Matter and CAD Office | Expected: Currency default to CAD || Step 5: Cost Code without Unit Rate, CAD Matter, USD Office1. Create new disb using cost code without unit rate.2. Enter CAD Matter and USD Office | Expected: Currency default to USD || Step 6: Cost Code without Unit Rate, CAD Matter, CAD Office1. Create new disb using cost code without unit rate.2. Enter CAD Matter and CAD Office | Expected: Currency default to CAD

Title: Disb Card - Default Currency - Matter Disb Base Currency from CDM_parms values
Steps: Step 1: Base Currency - Determines the currency the system will use to stamp a Base Amount disbursement entry in the disbursement detail tables.Standard Currency - Determines the currency the system will use to stamp a Standard Amount disbursement entry in the disbursement detail tables. Based on sp_cmscdcurr_rtn2sp.sql , all CDN type disb will always default currency from disb incurring office, regardless of the Matter and CDM Parms setup when cost code do not have unit rate. (this test is for cost code WITH unit rate). If Cost Code have unit rate, it will determine the currency from the Matter Setup then CDM Parms setup. || Step 2: Pre req Cost Code with Unit RateAppshell > Client Disbursements > Disbursement Setup > Disbursement Types.Has Unit Rate = YES Setup : MatterMatter Currency = CADMatter Office = London LON OfficesLondon Office Currency = GBPAuckland Office Currency = NZD System Currency = USD Environment Setting to toggle in this test: Disbursement Parms > Currency > Base Currency || Step 3: Base Currency = Matter Currency (MA), default1. Create disbursement using cost cost with unit rates flag checked.2. Office = Auckland | Expected: Currency default to Matter Currency - CAD || Step 4: Base Currency = Matter Office Currency (MO)1. Create disbursement using cost cost with unit rates flag checked.2. Office = Auckland | Expected: Currency default to Matter Office Currency - GBP || Step 5: Base Currency = Incurrring Office (IO)1. Create disbursement using cost cost with unit rates flag checked.2. Office = Auckland | Expected: Currency default to Disbursement Incurring Office Currency - NZD || Step 6: Base Currency = System Currency (SC)1. Create disbursement using cost cost with unit rates flag checked.2. Office = Auckland | Expected: Currency default to System Currency - USD

Title: Disb Card - Anticipated Disbursements Grid
Steps: Step 1: Pre req.In Admin App > Disbursements > Disbursement Options > Firm Options > 'Display Anticipated Disbursements Grid on Disbursement Cards' must be checked.Anticipated Disb required:1 Hard Disbursement with Vendor1 Soft Disbursement with Vendor1 Hard Disbursement without Vendor1 Soft Disbursement without Vendor | Expected: This enables the Anticipated Disbursements Grid to be displayed on the Disbursement card entry screen. || Step 2: Create a disbursement in Expert Disbursements by clicking the 'New' icon on:- Disbursements tab- Sessions tab (open or create a session first). | Expected: The Grid is displayed and is empty. || Step 3: Select a Client/Matter for which you did not post any anticipated disbursement entries. | Expected: The Grid displays a message = 'No Search Results'. || Step 4: Select a Client/Matter and the Hard/Soft flag according to the anticipated disbursement entries posted earlier. | Expected: The Grid displays the entries according to the Client/Matter and Hard/Soft flag combination. Only anticipated disbursements without a vendor will be displayed.Note - the rows that are displayed will only be posted anticipated disbursements which are not completely matched and which have no vendor attached to them. || Step 5: Change the Client/Matter and/or the Hard/Soft flag. | Expected: The Grid updates as each field is selected and displays any relevant rows according to the Client/Matter and Hard/Soft flag combination. || Step 6: Click on one of the rows in the grid when:- the currency field is not yet selected and is blank - the currency field matches the currency of the grid row selected- the currency field does not match the currency of the grid row selected. | Expected: The Copy to Disbursement button will only become enabled when:- the currency field is not yet selected and is blank - the currency field matches the currency of the grid row selected. || Step 7: Once enabled click the Copy to Disbursement button. | Expected: The selected item is copied to the entry card as follows:- Disb. Code is updated to the item copied- Currency is updated to the item copied (if not populated prior to clicking the Copy to Disbursement button)- Base amount is updated to the item copied- Bill amount is updated to the item copied. || Step 8: Save the disbursements as follows:- using the Save and Close button- using the Save and Add button and then the Crtl + F9 function. | Expected: - Using the Save and Close button, the disbursement is saved and the entry screen closed.- Using the Save and Add button and then the Crtl + F9 function, the disbursement is saved and the screen is cleared and then re-populated with the previous entries and the Grid is updated. || Step 9: Open/Edit:- an unposted disbursement- a posted disbursement | Expected: - For an unposted disbursement the Grid is displayed.- For a posted disbursement the Grid is not displayed.

Title: Disbursement- Retained_Billed_Amount
Steps: Step 1: This test case is based off a bug and a collection of integration test to test it. | Expected: Bug 215839: * Updates to the Retained_Billed_Amount field on CDT_Disb during Disb Edit, Mass Edit and Disb Split || Step 2: Setup :Admin > Billing > Billing options > Fees/Disbs > General > check 'Use Retained Billed Amount/Hours' || Step 3: Reset Retained Bill Amount when edit posted disbursement. | Expected: EditDisbursement_ResetsRetainedBilledAmount_WhenOneModRowCreated- editEditDisbursement_ResetsRetainedBilledAmount_WhenTwoModRowsCreated() - editEditDisbursement_DoesNotResetRetainedBilledAmount_WhenNoModRowsCreated() -""Retained_Billed_Amount reset to Null if edit creates mod row || Step 4: Reset Retained Bill Amount when mass edit posted disbursement. | Expected: MassEdit_ResetsRetainedBilledAmount_WhenOneModRowCreated()MassEdit_ResetsRetainedBilledAmount_WhenTwoModRowsCreated()MassEdit_ResetsRetainedBilledAmount_IfReevaluationChangesAmount()MassEdit_DoesNotResetRetainedBilledAmount_IfNoModRowChangeOrRevalue()Retained_Billed_Amount reset to Null if mass edit creates mod row || Step 5: Reset Retained Bill Amount when split and unsplit disbursement. | Expected: DisbursementSplitResetsRetainedBilledAmount()UndoSplit_Succeeds_AndRestoresRetainedBilledAmountOnOriginalDisbursement()Retained_Billed_Amount reset to Null if split. Unsplit will restore retained bill amount

Launch Expert Disbursements -> Disbursements -> Import Disbursements Button2. Launch Expert Disbursements -> Sessions -> Import Disbursements Button | Expected: The button is disabled. || Step 3: When user have ImportDisbursements security1. Launch Expert Disbursements -> Disbursements -> Import Disbursements Button2. Launch Expert Disbursements -> Sessions -> Import Disbursements Button | Expected: The button is enabled.

Title: Expert Disbursements - Shortcut Keys
Steps: Step 1: Ctrl+Shift+S | Expected: Save and Add || Step 2: Ctrl+S | Expected: Saves disbursements correctly || Step 3: Delete | Expected: Delete from Grids || Step 4: Ctrl+O | Expected: Opens from Grids || Step 5: Ctrl+N | Expected: Create new items || Step 6: F11 | Expected: Maximize and Minimize application || Step 7: F5 | Expected: Perform new search on grid lists || Step 8: Ctrl+F9 | Expected: Copy the all fields from previous entry screen when new one is created from Save & Add. || Step 9: Ctrl+Shift+F9 | Expected: Copy the selected field from previous entry screen when new one is created from Save & Add. || Step 10: Esc | Expected: Close a disb card

Title: Disb Card - Anticipated Disbursements Grid: Look and Feel
Steps: Step 1: General Checks | Expected: * Scroll bars* Column sorting* Row selection* Numbers, amounts and dates right aligned* Text left aligned* Money displays currency symbol || Step 2: Select | Expected: * Only a single row can be selected at a time || Step 3: Customizing the columns- Anticipated Amount- Balance- Bill Number- Currency - Disbursement ID- Disbursement Code | Expected: * Available columns (settings maintained)* Column order (settings maintained)* Column width (settings maintained)* Default columns || Step 4: Button | Expected: No Item selectedThe button will be disabled One Item selectedThe button will become enabled only if the currency of the row selected equals the currency selected on the disbursement entry card || Step 5: Performance | Expected: * Spinner displays in grid untill all grid items loaded

Title: Disb Import - Phase/task Validation
Steps: Step 1: Matter does not have matter plan - phase/task is invalid | Expected: Invoice and disb importedError on disb: Phase/Task invalidPhase/Task uno set to 0 || Step 2: Matter does not have matter plan - phase/task is valid | Expected: Invoice and disb importedPhase/Task uno set to correct uno || Step 3: Matter does not have matter plan - no phase/task | Expected: Invoice and disb importedPhase/Task uno set to 0 || Step 4: Matter has matter plan - phase/task does not exist | Expected: Invoice and disb importedError on disb: Phase/Task invalidError on disb: Phase/Task is requiredPhase/Task uno set to 0 || Step 5: Matter has matter plan - phase/task exists but is not vaid for this matter plan | Expected: Invoice and disb importedError on disb: Could not validate Phase/TaskPhase/Task uno set to uno of the phase task that was entered || Step 6: Matter has matter plan - phase/task is valid | Expected: Invoice and disb importedPhase/Task uno set to correct uno || Step 7: Matter has matter plan - no phase/task, matter plan does not have default | Expected: Invoice and disb importedError on disb: Phase/Task is requiredPhase/Task uno set to uno 0 || Step 8: Matter has matter plan - no phase/task, matter plan has default | Expected: Invoice and disb importedPhase/Task uno set to the default

Title: Disbursements - grid: Save searches
Steps: Step 1: Note: The generic granula tests to save search are in Framework Area: Payments Data stored: in configuration EXEC SECURITY.SetContextByName '' SELECT n.Path,n.Name,v.Content FROM Configuration.ConfigName n INNER JOIN Configuration.ConfigValue v ON n.Id = v.NameIdWHERE Path LIKE 'Preference.SavedSearches.PaymentsGridInstances.ExpertAccountsPayable%' || Step 2: Create searches | Expected: * Searches can be saved per user* Searches can be saved per firm (if the user has permissions)* Can create a new saved search including any of the items in the data provider section || Step 3: User Saved Searchesa) Run Expert Disbursements as the first userb) Go to Disbursements | Disbursementsc) Change the "Created in Expert" field to "Yes"d) Click the drop down at the top of the screen with the text "Saved Searches"e) Click "Save As" on the list that drops downf) From the Save Search As dialog window enter a name for your searchg) Ensure "Save as firm search" and "Set as default search" are both unticked and click Saveh) Close Expert Disbursementsi) Open Expert Disbursements as another user>> Shift + Right click on ExpertDisbursements.exe and select "Run as different user">> Run as the second user j) Go to Disbursements | Disbursementsk) Click the drop down at the top of the screen with the text "Saved Searches" | Expected: * You should not be able to see the search saved as the first user || Step 4: Firm Wide SearchesNote: The user saving the firm search will need the appropriate permissions inSecurity Manager under Disbursements | SaveFirmLevelSearch a) Run Expert Disbursements as the first userb) Go to Disbursements | Disbursementsc) Change the "Created in Expert" field to "Yes"d) Click the drop down at the top of the screen with the text "Saved Searches"e) Click "Save As" on the list that drops downf) From the Save Search As dialog window enter a name for your searchg) Ensure "Save as firm search" is ticked and "Set as default search" is unticked and click Saveh) Close Expert Disbursementsi) Open Expert Disbursements as another user>> Shift + Right click on ExpertDisbursements.exe and select "Run as different user">> Run as the second user j) Go to Disbursements | Disbursementsk) Click the drop down at the top of the screen with the text "Saved Searches" | Expected: * You should be able to see the new firm search under a Firm Searches category || Step 5: Load User Searchesa) Run Expert Disbursements as the first userb) Go to Disbursements | Disbursementsc) Click the drop down at the top of the screen with the text "Saved Searches" | Expected: * Can see and load the search you saved earlier* Can see and load firm searches || Step 6: Test Each Field a) Enable all fields in the Advanced Search Panelb) Populate all fields with somethingc) Save the searchd) Click Cleare) From the Saved Searches drop down select the save again | Expected: * Fields which are hidden should automatically become visible in the Advanced Search Panel* All fields can be saved to and recall their value correctly(Maybe we can create dacpac data that can have these saves) || Step 7: Test Defaulting User Searcha) Run Expert Disbursements as the first userb) Go to Disbursements | Disbursementsc) Change the "Status" field to "Billed"d) Click the drop down at the top of the screen with the text "Saved Searches"e) Click "Save As" on the list that drops downf) From the Save Search As dialog window enter a name for your searchg) Ensure "Save as firm search" is unticked and "Set as default search" is ticked and click Save and Close Expert Disbursementsh) Run Expert Disbursements as the first useri) Go to Disbursements | Disbursements | Expected: * The search designated as default should run automatically when the Disbursements Grid is loaded.* The name of the search should be populated in the Saved Searches drop down* A user search should have higher priority than a Firm search that is also set to default || Step 8: Test Defaulting Firm Search Note: Defaulting has a hierarchy which prefers user saved searches to firm saved searches. You must remove all user saved searches if you wish to have a firm search default. a) Run Expert Disbursements as the first userb) Go to Disbursements | Disbursementsc) Change the "Status" field to "Billed"d) Click the drop down at the top of the screen with the text "Saved Searches"e) Click "Save As" on the list that drops downf) From the Save Search As dialog window enter a name for your searchg) Ensure "Save as firm search" and "Set as default search" are both ticked and click Save and Close Expert Disbursementsh) Run Expert Disbursements as the second useri) Go to Disbursements | Disbursements | Expected: * The firm search designated as default should run automatically when the Disbursements Grid is loaded assuming there is no user search which is designated as default.* The name of the search should be populated in the Saved Searches drop down

Title: Cancel Disb: Non system currency
Steps: Step 1: Adding this test  case as there was no functional test for cancel. Will need some more workNote: Would be better if this could be amalgamated with the create test so as to not double up on that part of the process || Step 2: Pre reqs CAD RatesRate: 1.092007784100000Reciprocal: 0.915744388053213Cost code- Doesn't have rates || Step 3: Summary TablesGet the values so they can be compared before and after | Expected: DECLARE @disb as int = 5497DECLARE @matteruno as INT = (SELECT MATTER_UNO FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb)DECLARE @clientuno as INT = (SELECT CLIENT_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE MATTER_UNO = @matteruno)SELECT ''[CDH_SUMMARY_GL],COST_CODE,MATTER_UNO,PERIOD,BASE_NEW, TOBILL_NEW,BASE_MOD,TOBILL_MOD,*  FROM CDH_SUMMARY_GLWHERE MATTER_UNO = @matterunoSELECT ''[TBH_CLIENT_SUMM],CLIENT_UNO,ARBAL_HARD,* FROM TBH_CLIENT_SUMMWHERE CLIENT_UNO = @clientunoSELECT ''[TBH_MATTER_SUMM],MATTER_UNO,ARBAL_HARD,HARD_TOT,*FROM TBH_MATTER_SUMM WHERE MATTER_UNO = @matteruno || Step 4: Create Posted Disb 1. Create Disb- Currency = CAD- Base Amount = C$100- Narrative = some text- pb comments = some text- Enter other mandatory fields2. Save & Close3. Post | Expected: Disbursement created and posted  CDT_DISB WIP_STATUS = WEXPERT_DISB_STATUS = WSOURCE_TRAN_TYPE = CDNHELD_BY_AP = NDRUNO = the correct DRUNOPERIOD = The correct periodCURRENCY_CODE = CADBASE_AMT = 91.5744388053TOBILL_AMT = 91.5744388053STD_AMT = 91.5744388053BILLED_AMT = 0RETAINED_BILLED_AMT = NULL (its important that is not 0)CDT_DISB_NEWSOURCE_TRAN_TYPE = CDNDRUNO = the correct DRUNOPERIOD = The correct periodCURRENCY_CODE = CADBASE_AMT = 91.5744388053TOBILL_AMT = 91.5744388053STD_AMT = 91.5744388053CDT_TEXT (Narrative)TXT1 = Text from the narrative fieldCDT_TEXT (Prebill Comments)TXT1 = Text from the prebill comments field----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Declarations ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @disb asint= 5497DECLARE @matteruno asINT= (SELECT MATTER_UNO FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb)DECLARE @clientuno asINT= (SELECT CLIENT_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE MATTER_UNO = @matteruno)DECLARE @costcode asvarchar(10)= (SELECT COST_CODE FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb)DECLARE @trandate datetime= (SELECT TRAN_DATE FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb)DECLARE @quantity int= (SELECT BASE_QTY FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb)DECLARE @office asvarchar(10)= (SELECT DI_OFFC FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb)DECLARE @emp int= (SELECT DI_EMPL_UNO FROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb)DECLARE @cur as varchar(10) = (SELECT CURRENCY_CODE FROM  CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb)DECLARE @source as varchar(10) = (SELECT SOURCE_TRAN_TYP FROM  CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb)DECLARE @amt as int = (SELECT BASE_AMT FROM  CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb)DECLARE @auto as varchar(10) = (SELECT AUTO_CALCULATE FROM  CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb)DECLARE @markup as varchar(10) = (SELECT MARKUP_BASE FROM  CDL_COST WHERE COST_CODE = @costcode)----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CDT_DISB --When disb amount is set from a rate the RATE_METHOD is set accordingly. I think --from the TBM_RATE_DISB.GROUP_TYPE If rate not used then X--The anticpated get M. There may be more *** need to investigate-- Matter is Rate level 0, group type 1-- Client is rate level 0, group type 2-- Rate set is rate level 0, group type 3-- Cost Code is rate level 1, group type 4---------------------------------------------------------------------------------exec sp_cmscdcalc @matteruno, @costcode, @trandate, @quantity, @office, @emp, @cur, @source, @amt, @auto, @markupSELECT''[CDT_DISB],d.DISB_UNO,d.WIP_STATUS,EXPERT_DISB_STATUS,SESSION,d.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP,d.MATTER_UNO[Matter],m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,c.CLIENT_NAME +' | '+ m.MATTER_NAME[Client | Matter],d.TRAN_DATE,d.HOLD_DATE,d.HELD_BY_AP, d.PHTASK_UNO,d.HARDSOFT,d.COST_CODE, d.DISB_REF,d.AUTO_CALCULATE,d.DRUNO,d.PERIOD,d.CURRENCY_CODE[Cur Entered] ,d.BILL_QTY,d.BASE_QTY,BASE_AMT,TOBILL_AMT,STD_AMT,BILLED_AMT,RETAINED_BILLED_AMT,d.OFFC,d.DI_OFFC,d.DI_EMPL_UNO,d.AU_EMPL_UNO,d.LOCATION_CODE,d.PROJ,d.TAXIN_JURISDIC,d.BILL_PRINT,d.ACTIVITY_COUNT,SPLIT_NUM,d.NAR_TEXT_ID,dt0.txt1[Narrative],--RTRIM(CONVERT(varchar(MAX), ISNULL(CONVERT(char(250), dt0.txt1) + CONVERT(char(250), dt0.txt2) + CONVERT(char(250), dt0.txt3) + CONVERT(char(250), dt0.txt4) + CONVERT(char(250), dt0.txt5) + CONVERT(char(250), dt0.txt6), ''))) as [Narrative],d.PB_TEXT_ID,pbt0.txt1[Prebill Text],--RTRIM(CONVERT(varchar(MAX), ISNULL(CONVERT(char(250), pbt0.txt1) + CONVERT(char(250), pbt0.txt2) + CONVERT(char(250), pbt0.txt3) + CONVERT(char(250), pbt0.txt4) + CONVERT(char(250), pbt0.txt5) + CONVERT(char(250), pbt0.txt6), ''))) as [Prebill Text],d.BILL_TRAN_UNO,SOURCE_TRAN_UNO,RATE_METHOD,d.LAST_MODIFIED,d.*FROM CDT_DISB d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON m.MATTER_UNO = d.MATTER_UNOINNERJOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON c.CLIENT_UNO = m.CLIENT_UNOLEFT JOIN CDT_TEXT dt0 on d.NAR_TEXT_ID  = dt0.text_idLEFT JOIN CDT_TEXT pbt0 on d.PB_TEXT_ID  = pbt0.text_idWHERE DISB_UNO = @disb----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CDT_DISB_NEW---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[CDT_DISB_NEW],* FROM CDT_DISB_NEW WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CDT_DISB_MOD ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[CDT_DISB_MOD],* FROM CDT_DISB_MOD WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb || Step 5: Cancel Disb- Employee- Reason | Expected: Disbursement CanceledCDT_DISB (updated) WIP_STATUS = XEXPERT_DISB_STATUS = XSOURCE_TRAN_TYPE = CDNHELD_BY_AP = NDRUNO = the correct DRUNOPERIOD = The correct periodCURRENCY_CODE = CADBASE_AMT = 91.5744388053TOBILL_AMT = 91.5744388053STD_AMT = 91.5744388053BILLED_AMT = 0RETAINED_BILLED_AMT = NULL (its important that is not 0)CDT_DISB_MOD (created)SOURCE_TRAN_TYPE = CDM Is this correct?Bug 256887 - Cancel non billed disbursement is setting CDT_DISB_MOD.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP to CDMTYPE = XADJ_CODE = Reason code that was entered on the cancel formAU__EMPL_UNO = Employee that was entered on the cancel formDRUNO = the correct DRUNOPERIOD = The correct periodCURRENCY_CODE = CADBASE_AMT_VAR = -91.5744388053TOBILL_AMT_VAR = -91.5744388053STD_AMT_VAR = -91.5744388053

Title: Jobs: Split Disb
Steps: Step 1: Note: As the job process is quick, there is no time to check that the lock occurred so need to check using sql profilter: search for: sp_cmsmakelockcio || Step 2: Split DisbEnter split details and save | Expected: Job runs* Local notification sent so notification form displays * Job starts processing* Parent Disb is locked, the splits processed then lock removed- lock applied with 20 min expiry- Lock Owner = B* Job status = R while processing* Service sends notifications to notification form and recent activity grid* All selected items processed* Job status = C when completed* There are no orphaned locks when job is completed* Grid refreshed at end of job* Recent activities grid displays message of split number, source disb id, new disb ids Added in 83---------------------------------------------------------------------- Get the most recent job--------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @job asintSET @job = (SELECTTOP (1) JOB_QUEUE_UNO FROM CDE_JOB_QUEUE ORDERBY JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC)--SET @job = 25---------------------------------------------------------------------- Job--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT'JOB'[JOB],j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO,j.JOB_TYPE,j.JOB_STATUS,UPDATE_MESSAGE,j.TOTAL_ITEMS,j.PROCESSED_ITEMS,FAILED_ITEMS,ERROR_COUNT,DATEDIFF(mi,j.INITIATED_DATE,j.LAST_MODIFIED)[Process Mins],j.INITIATED_BY, IS_REVIEWED,IS_CANCELLED,j.INITIATED_DATE,j.LAST_MODIFIEDFROM CDE_JOB_QUEUE j --WHERE j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @job ORDER BY j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC ---------------------------------------------------------------------- DISB ALERTS--------------------------------------------------------------------SELECTDISTINCT'ALERTS'[ALERTS],a.SOURCE_TYPE,a.SOURCE_UNO,a.SOURCE_NUMBER,a.MESSAGE_KEY,a.MESSAGE_CONTEXT,a.MESSAGE_INTERNAL,a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO, a.JOB_ALERT_UNO,a.ALERT_LEVEL,a.IS_REVIEWED,a.CREATED_DATEFROM CDE_JOB_ALERT aLEFTJOIN CDE_JOB_ALERT j ON j.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = a.JOB_QUEUE_UNOWHERE a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO = @jobORDERBY a.JOB_QUEUE_UNO DESC,a.SOURCE_UNO--, a.ALERT_UNO DESC

Title: Disb Card - Expansion Codes - Default Narrative
Steps: Step 1: Available from 82SP1.EX0011 onwards*Expansion Code narrative default when Client.Matter, PhaseTask (optional), and Disb Code are filled in. || Step 2: Turn off Firm Options > Generate Disbursement Text flagBug 236724 : User Expansion Code can be selected when setup Firm Disb Type || Step 3: Setup - Expansion CodesAdmin > Hub Setup > Firm Setup > Expansion Code Expansion Code DISB1Expansion Type = DExpansion Text = Expansion Code 1 from Client.Matter Matter Plan Expansion Code DISB2Expansion Type = DExpansion Text = Expansion Code 2 from Task Code Expansion Code DISB3Expansion Type = DExpansion Text = Expansion Code 3 from Disb Code || Step 4: Setup Matter Plan Create two phase task.Classic > Task Based Billing Management > Task SetsAdd New Phase1.Task1 and Phase2.Task2.Set Task1 Disb Expansion Code = DISB1 Link Phase TasksClassic > Task Based Billing Management > Plan CodeLink Phase1.Task1. to AnyPhase.L110.Link Phase2.Task2 to AnyPhase.AnyTask Attach Matter Plan to a matter.Classic > Matter Management > Time and Billing > Billing tab || Step 5: Setup Task CodeAdmin > Hub Setup > Time and Billing Setup > Tasks  Create new or use existing task code. This test case uses existing L110 task code.Disb Expansion Code = DISB2 || Step 6: Setup Disb CodeAdmin > Disbursements > Disb Options > Disb Type Disb Expansion Code = DISB3 || Step 7: Default narrative from Matter Plan with Expansion Code1. Create disbursement with:- Client.Matter with matter plan- Phase1.Task1- Disb with DISB3 expansion code | Expected: Matter plan expansion code narrative is defaulted - DISB1 Expansion Text = Expansion Code 1 from Client.Matter Matter Plan || Step 8: Default narrative from Task with Expansion Code1. Create disbursement with:- Client.Matter without matter plan- Phase1.Task1- Disb with DISB3 expansion code | Expected: Task expansion code narrative is defaulted - DISB2Expansion Text = Expansion Code 2 from Task Code || Step 9: Default narrative from Disb Code with Expansion Code1. Create disbursement with:- Client.Matter without matter plan- Phase2.Task2 (without expansion code setup)- Disb with DISB3 expansion code | Expected: Task expansion code narrative is defaulted - DISB3Expansion Text = Expansion Code 3 from Disb Code || Step 10: Defaulting narrative from Expansion Code when Firm Options > Generate Disbursement Text = Y.Create disbursement with:- Client.Matter with matter plan- Phase1.Task1- Disb with DISB3 expansion code | Expected: Generated narrative is populated on a new form.Narrative change window will pop up window when Client.Matter, PhaseTask and Disb Code is entered.Click OK - Narrative change to DISB1 Expansion TextExpansion Text = Expansion Code 1 from Client.Matter Matter PlanClick Cancel - Narrative remain unchange.

Title: Disb Import - Auto Calculate Feature (821)
Steps: Step 1: Is this test case still valid? || Step 2: Save the attached template file to your local drive. Review the attached template. It has twelve rows which represent different scenarios of how users can enter information to be imported. The result for each row will be calculated individually based on the information for that row in the template and the setup of the unit rates as set out in step 2 below. The disbursement entry is created with these results and all other normal disbursement entry checks and validations are done. || Step 3: The following setup is required to be done prior to doing the disbursement import:1 - confirm that a client with code 20802 is in the system, else change the template to another client2 - confirm that a matter with code 1 is in the system for the client in point 1 above, else setup and change the template to another matter3 - in Entity Manager, edit the matter being used and under Time & Billing set the Disbursement Rate Set to PREM10, or setup your own and link it to this matter4 - confirm that the disbursement code BLSOFT is setup as a soft disbursement only and with unit rates applicable, else setup a code and change the template accordingly5 - confirm that the disbursement code BLDEF is setup as a hard disbursement only and with unit rates applicable, else setup a code and change the template accordingly6 - in Expert Rates edit the PREM10 rate set for Disbursement Rates and add rates, as specified below, for the two codes in points 4 & 5 above7 - Set unit rates for BLSOFT for USD and a start date before 1/1/2020. Unit rate 1 = 100 for 10 and unit rate 2 = 508 - Set unit rates for BLDEF for USD and a start date before 1/1/2020. Unit rate 1 = 200 for 10 and unit rate 2 = 150 || Step 4: In Expert Disbursements click the Import Disbursement icon.In the next screen, navigate to and select the saved template file.Either select or create a new mapping profile. If creating a new mapping profile, map all the fields in the template. Ensure that the mapping profile is set for Hard disbursements.Once ready, import the file and all the rows will be processed and the disbursement entries created. || Step 5: Data of each row in the file:1 - Code = BLSOFT, Qty = 0, Amount = blank, Bill Amount = blank2 - Code = BLSOFT, Qty = blank, Amount = blank, Bill Amount = blank3 - Code = BLSOFT, Qty = 11, Amount = blank, Bill Amount = blank4 - Code = BLSOFT, Qty = 11, Amount = 111, Bill Amount = blank5 - Code = BLSOFT, Qty = 11, Amount = blank, Bill Amount = 15666 - Code = BLSOFT, Qty = 11, Amount = 123, Bill Amount = 4567 - Code = BLDEF, Qty = 0, Amount = blank, Bill Amount = blank8 - Code = BLDEF, Qty = blank, Amount = blank, Bill Amount = blank9 - Code = BLDEF, Qty = 11, Amount = blank, Bill Amount = blank10 - Code = BLDEF, Qty = 11, Amount = 222, Bill Amount = blank11 - Code = BLDEF, Qty = 11, Amount = blank, Bill Amount = 258712 - Code = BLDEF, Qty = 11, Amount = 987, Bill Amount = 654 | Expected: Disbursements are created with the Date, Client/Matter, Disb Code, Office, Currency and Quantity as from the import file. The auto-calculation flag, base and bill amounts will be calculated and set as follows:1 - Flag is On, Base amt = 0, Bill amt = 0. Additional warning that the BLSOFT code cannot be used for hard disbursements2 - Flag is On, Base amt = 0, Bill amt = 0. Additional warning that the BLSOFT code cannot be used for hard disbursements3 - Flag is On, Base amt = 1050, Bill amt = 1050. Additional warning that the BLSOFT code cannot be used for hard disbursements4 - Flag is Off, Base amt = 111, Bill amt = 111. Additional warning that the BLSOFT code cannot be used for hard disbursements5 - Flag is On, Base amt = 1050, Bill amt = 1566. Additional warning that the BLSOFT code cannot be used for hard disbursements6 - Flag is Off, Base amt = 123, Bill amt = 456. Additional warning that the BLSOFT code cannot be used for hard disbursements7 - Flag is On, Base amt = 0, Bill amt = 0.8 - Flag is On, Base amt = 0, Bill amt = 0.9 - Flag is On, Base amt = 2150, Bill amt = 2150.10 - Flag is Off, Base amt = 222, Bill amt = 222.11 - Flag is On, Base amt = 2150, Bill amt = 2587.12 - Flag is Off, Base amt = 987, Bill amt = 654.

Title: Split Disb - With Spilt and Unsplit Items
Steps: Step 1: Note: There are some issues with STD_AMT calculation. Sometimes the value is to 0. These issues are seen in both classic and expert. The calculations also different between expert products, AP, Disb, Billing. The billing team are looking into this || Step 2: Pre preqs 2 MattersCurrency = USD Disbs Currency = USDDisb item 1 = 100Disb item 2 = 100Posted | Expected: CDT_DISB (for disb item 1)CURRENCY_CODE = USDBASE_AMT = 100TOBILL_AMT = 100STD_AMT = 100SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = CDNTRANSFERRED = NEXPERT_DISB_STATUS = WWIP_STATUS = WACTIVITY_COUNT = 0 CDT_DISB (for disb item 2)CURRENCY_CODE = USDBASE_AMT = 100TOBILL_AMT = 100STD_AMT = 100SOURCE_TRAN_TYPE = CDNTRANSFERED = NEXPERT_DISB_STATUS = WWIP_STATUS = WACTIVITY_COUNT = 0 SELECT DISB_UNO,CURRENCY_CODE,BASE_AMT ,TOBILL_AMT ,STD_AMT ,SOURCE_TRAN_TYP ,TRANSFERRED ,EXPERT_DISB_STATUS ,WIP_STATUS ,ACTIVITY_COUNT ,* FROM CDT_DISB d WHERE LAST_MODIFIED > Convert(DateTime, DATEDIFF(DAY, 0, GETDATE())) || Step 3: Split Disb Items (use disb app) Disb 1- Split 100 to another matter- Undo splitDisb 2- Split 80 to another matter- Undo split | Expected: Disb GridOriginal 2 disbs displayCanceled split disbs display Disb 1Status = WBase Amount = 100ToBill AMount = 100Standard Amount = 100 Disb 2Status = WBase Amount = 100ToBill AMount = 100Standard Amount = 100 Disb 3Status = XBase Amount = 100ToBill AMount = 100Standard Amount = 100 Disb 4Status = XBase Amount = 80ToBill AMount = 80Standard Amount = 80 CDT_DISB (for disb item 1) - updatedCURRENCY_CODE = USDBASE_AMT = 100TOBILL_AMT = 100STD_AMT = 100SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = CDNSPLIT_NUM = NULLTRANSFERRED = NEXPERT_DISB_STATUS = WWIP_STATUS = WACTIVITY_COUNT = 2 CDT_DISB (for disb item 2) - updatedCURRENCY_CODE = USDBASE_AMT = 100TOBILL_AMT = 100STD_AMT = 100SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = CDNSPLIT_NUM = NULLTRANSFERRED = NEXPERT_DISB_STATUS = WWIP_STATUS = WACTIVITY_COUNT = 2 CDT_DISB (for disb item 3 for Disb item 1 split) - created and updateCURRENCY_CODE = USDBASE_AMT = 100TOBILL_AMT = 100STD_AMT = 100SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = APSPLIT_NUM = 0TRANSFERRED = SEXPERT_DISB_STATUS = XWIP_STATUS = XACTIVITY_COUNT = 2 CDT_DISB (for disb item 4 for Disb item 2 split) - created and updateCURRENCY_CODE = USDBASE_AMT = 80TOBILL_AMT = 80STD_AMT = 80SOURCE_TRAN_TYP = APSPLIT_NUM = 0TRANSFERRED = SEXPERT_DISB_STATUS = XWIP_STATUS = XACTIVITY_COUNT = 2 || Step 4: Cancel an invoice with Split/ Unsplit  Disb Items (use Expert AP & Expert Disb apps) | Expected: Cancelling an invoice with disbursement split / Unsplit i-e cancelled disbursement, does not result in the generation of extra APX WIP entries in CDT_DISB_MOD.Bug 270149: BUG: Invoice with disbursement split in Expert Disbursement generates extra APX WIP

Title: Disb Import - Session and Disbursement dates
Steps: Step 1: Note: Parameter dates are cached so you'll need to reopen the app between each step where the min/max dates are changed | Expected: SQL queries used in this testSELECT MIN_DATE, MAX_DATE,* FROM CDM_PARMSSELECT SES_DATE,* FROM CDS_DISB_Z ORDER BY SESSION desc----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Declarations ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @disb as int= DECLARE @session as int= (SELECTSESSIONFROM CDT_DISB WHERE DISB_UNO = @disb)SELECT''[CDS_DISB_Z],*FROM CDS_DISB_ZWHERESESSION= @sessionSELECT''[CDT_DISB],d.DISB_UNO,d.WIP_STATUS,EXPERT_DISB_STATUS,SESSION,d.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP,m.CLNT_MATT_CODEBASE_AMT,TOBILL_AMT,STD_AMT,BILLED_AMT,RETAINED_BILLED_AMT,d.LAST_MODIFIEDFROM CDT_DISB d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON m.MATTER_UNO = d.MATTER_UNOWHERE DISB_UNO = @disb----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Messages ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[CDT_MESSAGE],* FROM CDT_MESSAGEWHERE SOURCE_TYPE ='Disbursement'AND SOURCE_UNO = @disb || Step 2: Pre reqs - File for importDisb 1Date = todayDisb 2Date = 01/01/1999Disb 3Date = 01/01/2040Disb 4Date is not entered || Step 3: Today's date > min date and < max date - date is mapped1. Set the min/max datesUPDATE CDM_PARMS SET MIN_DATE = '2000-01-01 00:00:00.000',MAX_DATE = '2030-01-01 00:00:00.000'2. Run the import wizard- Select the file with the disbs are per the pre reqs- Use a mapping where the date IS mapped | Expected: Import processedWizard- No session date warning message in final page of wizardSessionSession date = todayDisbursementsDisb 1 - Imported with no errors- Trans date = todayDisb 2 - Imported with error- Trans date = 01/01/1999Disb 3 - Imported with error- Trans date = 01/01/2040Disb 4 - Imported with no errors- Trans date = today || Step 4: Today's date > min date and< max date - date not mapped1. Run the import wizard- Select the file with the disbs are per the pre reqs- Use a mapping where the date IS NOT mapped | Expected: Import processedWizard- No session date warning message in final page of wizardSessionSession date = todayDisbursementsDisb 1 - Imported with no errors- Trans date = today  Disb 2 - Imported with no errors- Trans date = todayDisb 3 - Imported with no errors- Trans date = todayDisb 4 - Imported with no errors- Trans date = today || Step 5: Today's date > min date and > max date - date is mapped1. Set the min/max datesUPDATE CDM_PARMS SET MIN_DATE = '2000-01-01 00:00:00.000',MAX_DATE = '2020-01-01 00:00:00.000'2. Run the import wizard- Select the file with the disbs are per the pre reqs- Use a mapping where the date IS mapped | Expected: Import processedWizard- Warning message in final page of wizardThe session date is being defaulted to the Disbursement Max Date (01 January 2020)SessionSession date = 01/01/2020DisbursementsDisb 1 - Imported with error- Trans date = todayDisb 2 - Imported with error- Trans date = 01/01/1999Disb 3 - Imported with error- Trans date = 01/01/2040Disb 4 - Imported with no errors- Trans date = 01/01/2020 || Step 6: Today's date < min date and < max date - date is mapped1. Set the min/max datesUPDATE CDM_PARMS SET MIN_DATE = '2029-01-01 00:00:00.000',MAX_DATE = '2030-01-01 00:00:00.000'2. Run the import wizard- Select the file with the disbs are per the pre reqs- Use a mapping where the date IS mapped | Expected: Import processedWizard- Warning message in final page of wizardThe session date is being defaulted to the Disbursement Max Date (01 January 2030)SessionSession date = 01/01/2030DisbursementsDisb 1 - Imported with error- Trans date = todayDisb 2 - Imported with error- Trans date = 01/01/1999Disb 3 - Imported with error- Trans date = 01/01/2040Disb 4 - Imported with no errors- Trans date = 01/01/2030

Title: Disb - STD amount with rates and markup at cost code level only
Steps: Step 1: Pre req dataNote: The calculation of STD amount is different dependant on the source type- For CDN (billing and disb app) calculation is based of the rates- For AP and CH (Invoice, Payment and Expenses) calculation is based off the base amountNote: You can use your own amounts but probably easier to follow the calculations by using the example amounts in the test caseDisb Code 1Classic | Client Disbursements | Disbursement Setup | Disbursement Types- Allow soft = Y- Allow Hard = Y- Allow edit of base values = Y- Apply markup = Y- Has Unit rates = Y Rates row for Disb Code 1- Has one rates row with unit rates and set a markup amount- USD currencyUnit Rate 1 = 1.00 Markup amount = .10 Disb Code 2Classic | Client Disbursements | Disbursement Setup | Disbursement Types- Allow soft = Y- Allow Hard = Y- Allow edit of base values = Y- Apply markup = Y- Has Unit rates = NRates row for Disb Code 2- Has a markup %Markup % = 10 for CADDisb Code 3Classic | Client Disbursements | Disbursement Setup | Disbursement Types- Allow soft = Y- Allow Hard = Y- Allow edit of base values = Y- Apply markup = Y- Has Unit rates = Y Rates row for Disb Code 3- Has a markup %Markup % = 10 for CAD || Step 2: New Disb Disb code 1 - Client/matter- Disb code- Currency = USD- Other mandatory fields | Expected: Base amount and Bill amount populated Auto calc = ONBase Amount = .10 (markup amount)Bill Amount = .10 (copied from base amount) || Step 3: Set the quantity - Quantity = 1- Save & Close | Expected: Base amount and Bill amount updatedFormAuto calc = ONBase Amount = 1.10 (Unit rates x 1 + markup amount)Bill Amount = 1.10 (copied from base amount)CDT_DISBSTD_AMT = 1.00 (unit rates x 1) || Step 4: Edit the quantity - Quantity = 2- Save & Close | Expected: Base amount and Bill amount updatedFormAuto calc = ONBase Amount = 2.10 (Unit rates x 2+ markup amount)Bill Amount = 2.10 (copied from base amount)CDT_DISBSTD_AMT = 2.00 (unit rates x 2) || Step 5: Edit the quantity and Bill amount- Quantity = 3- Bill Amount = 100- Save & Close | Expected: Base amount and Bill amount updatedFormAuto calc = OFFBase Amount = 3.10 (Unit rates x 3+ markup amount)Bill Amount = 100.00 (as entered)CDT_DISBSTD_AMT = 3.00 (unit rates x 3) || Step 6: Edit the quantity - Quantity = 4- Save & Close | Expected: Base amount and Bill amount updatedFormAuto calc = OFFBase Amount = 3.10 (no auto calc) 3.20 as markup was applied againBill Amount = 3.10 (copied from base amount) 3.20 as base amount is incorrectBug 173942 - Client/matter- Disb code- Currency = USD- Other mandatory fields | Expected: Base amount and Bill amount populated Auto calc = ONBase Amount = .10 (markup amount)Bill Amount = .10 (copied from base amount) || Step 3: Set the quantity - Quantity = 1- Save & Close | Expected: Base amount and Bill amount updatedFormAuto calc = ONBase Amount = 2.10 (Unit rates x 1 + markup amount)Bill Amount = 2.10 (copied from base amount)CDT_DISBSTD_AMT = 2.00 (unit rates x 1) || Step 4: Edit the quantity - Quantity = 2- Save & Close | Expected: Base amount and Bill amount updatedFormAuto calc = ONBase Amount = 4.10 (Unit rates x 2+ markup amount)Bill Amount = 4.10 (copied from base amount)CDT_DISBSTD_AMT = 4.00 (Unit rates x 2) || Step 5: Edit the quantity and Bill amount- Quantity = 3- Bill Amount = 100- Save & Close | Expected: Base amount and Bill amount updatedFormAuto calc = OFFBase Amount = 6.10 (Unit rates x 3+ markup amount)Bill Amount = 100.00 (as entered)CDT_DISBSTD_AMT = 6.00 (Unit rates x 3) || Step 6: Edit the quantity - Quantity = 4- Save & Close | Expected: Base amount and Bill amount not updatedFormAuto calc = OFFBase Amount = 6.10 (no auto calc) 6.20 as markup was applied againBill Amount = 6.10 (copied from base amount) 6.20 as base amount is incorrectBug 173942 - Title: Expert Disb: Security: Disbursements -  SaveFirmLevelMappingProfile and SaveUserLevelMappingProfile user rights
Steps: Step 1: SaveUserLevelMappingProfile available from 822.EX3 and 83. || Step 2: Pre reqcreate a few firm and user mapping profiles in Disbursements Import. || Step 3: When having both SaveFirmLevelMappingProfile and SaveUserLevelMappingProfile | Expected: In Import Disb Wizard- Choose: shows firm and user mapping profile- Edit: shows firm and user mapping profile- Copy: shows firm and user mapping profile, have the option to save new copy as firm or user- Create: can select to save new mapping profile as firm or user profile on next screen (where you enter profile name). || Step 4: When having SaveFirmLevelMappingProfile but NOT SaveUserLevelMappingProfile | Expected: In Import Disb Wizard- Choose: shows firm and user mapping profile- Edit: shows firm only- Copy: shows firm and user mapping profile, new profile created from copy will be firm only even if it is copied from user profile- Create: can create new, default to firm || Step 5: When NOT having SaveFirmLevelMappingProfile but having SaveUserLevelMappingProfile | Expected: In Import Disb Wizard- Choose: shows firm and user mapping profile- Edit: shows user only- Copy: shows firm and user mapping profile, new profile created from copy will be user only even if it is copied from firm profile- Create: can create new, default to user || Step 6: When not having both SaveFirmLevelMappingProfile and SaveUserLevelMappingProfile | Expected: In Import Disb Wizard- Choose: shows firm and user mapping profile- Edit: disabled- Copy: disabled- Create: disabled

Title: Disb Import - Rates Hierachy Level 1 contraints have unit rates and markup
Steps: Step 1: Note: This uses a common SP created for classic. Note: Matter and client constraints can only have a max of 1 of each set up for each cost codeThe hierachy for this test is:Note: This does not match the documentation. Decission was made to change the documentation rather than the code1. The disbursement rate 2. The matter constraint rates 3. The client constraint rates 4. The Rate Set attached to the matter5. The cost code rates || Step 2: Pre req dataClient 1Matter 1 for client Client 2:Has client constraintsMatter 1 for client 2Has Matter contraintsMatter 2 for client 2Disb Cost CodeClassic | Client Disbursements | Disbursement Setup | Disbursement Types- Allow soft = Y- Allow Hard = Y- Allow edit of base values = Y- Apply markup = Y- Has Unit rates = Y || Step 3: Cost Code rates and markup1. Add Rates row 1 for costs code: level 1, markups- Rate level = 1- USD currency- Effective date = 1/1/2019- Markup amount = 10.00112. Add Rates row 2 for cost code: level 1, unit rates- Rate level = 1- USD currency- Effective date = 1/12/2019- Unit Rate 1 = 2.00 3. Import Disb- Client/matter = C1.M1- Disb code- Other mandatory fields- Quantity = 1 | Expected: Uses rates row 2 for unit rate then rates row 1 for markup 2 + 10 = 12FormBase = 12 (displays 10 until the quantity added)Bill = 12 (displays 10 until the quantity added)CDT_DISBRATE_METHOD = 4BASE_AMT = 12TOBILL_AMT = 12STD_AMT = 2 (standard amount doesn't use the markup)DECLARE @disb asint= Title: Rules: Disb rules in multiple applications
Steps: Step 1: Select to create a new rule for AP Disbs1. Design studio | Expert Accounts Payable | Rules | 2. Right click on the end point Detail Validation | Disbursement Validation3. Add rule | Create new4. Enter header details- Name- Code5. Enter activity details- Enter message (text must be in double quotes)"AP: Amount can't be greater than 100"- Add field Disbursement.BaseAmount- Set operator to >- Set value to 1006. Save | Expected: Rule is savedSELECT CODE,r.NAME,r.INACTIVE,ENTITY_ASSOCIATED,RULE_KEY,rv.EFFECTIVE_FROM,rv.EFFECTIVE_UNTIL,rc.NAME, rc.DATA_TYPE,r.* FROM FWM_RULE rLEFT JOIN FWM_RULE_VERSION rv ON r.RULE_UNO = rv.RULE_UNO LEFT JOIN FWM_RULE_CONTRACT rc ON r.RULE_UNO = rc.RULE_UNO ORDER BY r.RULE_UNO desc || Step 2: Select to create a new rule for Disbs1. Design studio | Expert Disbursements | Rules | 2. Right click on the end point Disbursement processing | On Disbursement Save |3. Add rule | Create new4. Enter header details- Name- Code5. Enter activity details- Enter message (text must be in double quotes)"Disb: Amount can't be greater than 100"- Add field Disbursement.BaseAmount- Set operator to >- Set value to 1006. Save | Expected: Rule is saved || Step 3: Select to create a new rule for Billing1. Design studio | Expert Billing | Rules | 2. Right click on the end point Prebill Processing Disbursement Validation 3. Add rule | Create new4. Enter header details- Name- Code5. Enter activity details- Enter message (text must be in double quotes)"Billing: Amount can't be greater than 100"- Add field Disbursement.BaseAmount- Set operator to >- Set value to 1006. Save | Expected: Rule is saved || Step 4: Create disbursement1. New disb- Amount = 100.01- Enter other mandatory data4. Save & Close | Expected: Only Disb Error message displayed and error savedNote: If the disb had been created in AP or Billing you would get both the Disb error and the error from the specific application- Error message from DisbursementsCDT_MESSAGE 1 created- Just the disb message

Title: Split Disb - Expense disb with tax
Steps: Step 1: Tested by APP_POST_DisbursementSplitTaxUpdate_Test || Step 2: Create expense report1. Expenses app2. Create expense report3. Add a billable item e.g. Telephone- User a Jur that has tax e.g. KLJ4. Wait the the report is approved | Expected: Approved expense report created Has a disb DECLARE @invoice as varchar (100) = 'NZ10-146629'DECLARE @bank as varchar(100) = 'busd' --bank to be used on payment DECLARE @employee as int = (SELECT EXP_RPT_EMPL_UNO FROM APT_INVOICE WHERE INVOICE_NUM = @invoice)DECLARE @employeeoffice as varchar(20) = (SELECT OFFC FROM HBM_PERSNL WHERE EMPL_UNO = @employee) DECLARE @tran as int = (SELECT TRAN_UNO FROM APT_INVOICE WHERE INVOICE_NUM = @invoice)DECLARE @paybankcomp as varchar (100) = (SELECT o.COMPANY_CODE FROM TBM_BANK b JOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE WHERE b.BANK_CODE = @bank)DECLARE @paybankcur as varchar (100) = (SELECT CURRENCY_CODE FROM TBM_BANK WHERE BANK_CODE = @bank) DECLARE @TranType VARCHAR(3) = 'AP' --for the validation5DECLARE @Xml XML -- for the validation  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Invoice --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- SELECT ''[APT_INVOICE],inv.TRAN_UNO,inv.SCHEDULE_NUM,EXP_RPT_EMPL_UNO,EXP_RPT_NAME,INVOICE_STATUS,EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS,inv.EXP_RPT_STATUS,inv.APTYPE_CODE,PAID_DATE,SESSION,DRUNO,PERIOD,inv.CURRENCY_CODE,inv.TC_CODE,INV_AMT,BALANCE,EXP_RPT_AMT,EXP_RPT_BILLABLE_AMT,EXP_RPT_NON_BILLABLE_AMT,inv.ORIGINAL_AMT,TC_INV_AMT FROM APT_INVOICE invLEFT JOIN HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT ba ON inv.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = ba.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNOWHERE inv.TRAN_UNO = @tranORDER BY inv.TRAN_UNO DESC ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Invoice amounts--------------------------------------------------------------------------------- SELECT ''[APT_INVOICE_AMT],ia.INV_TRAN_UNO,ia.SOURCE_TRAN_UNO,chq.REQUEST_NUM,ia.TRAN_TYPE, ia.SCHEDULE_NUM,ia.DRUNO,ia.SIGN,ia.AP_AMT,ia.PAID_AMT,ia.TC_AP_AMT,ia.TC_PAID_AMT ,ia.TC_CODE ,EXP_RPT_EMPL_UNO,ia.PERIOD,ia.ROW_UNO--,ia.* FROM APT_INVOICE_AMT iaLEFT JOIN APT_CHECK chq ON ia.SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = chq.TRAN_UNOWHERE INV_TRAN_UNO = @tranORDER BY ia.ROW_UNO  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Invoice Tax ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[APT_INVOICE_TAX],* FROM APT_INVOICE_TAXWHERE INVOICE_TRAN_UNO = @tran ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Invoice disb--------------------------------------------------------------------------------- SELECT ''[CDT_DISB],d.DISB_UNO,d.WIP_STATUS,HELD_BY_AP,d.HARDSOFT,d.COST_CODE,d.DRUNO,PERIOD,d.CURRENCY_CODE[Cur Entered] ,BASE_AMT,TOBILL_AMT,STD_AMT,BILLED_AMT,RETAINED_BILLED_AMT,d.RATE_METHOD,d.TRAN_DATE,d.BILL_QTY,d.BASE_QTY,d.ENTRY_EMPL_UNO,d.DI_EMPL_UNO,d.BL_EMPL_UNO,d.HOLD_DATE,d.BILL_PRINT,d.ACTIVITY_COUNT,SPLIT_NUM,PHTASK_UNO,d.BILL_TRAN_UNO,SOURCE_TRAN_UNO,d.MATTER_UNO[Matter],m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,c.CLIENT_NAME + ' | ' + m.MATTER_NAME[Client | Matter],d.ACTIVITY_COUNT,d.SOURCE_TRAN_TYP,SESSION,TRANSFERRED,EXPERT_DISB_STATUS,d.LAST_MODIFIED--,d.*FROM CDT_DISB d JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON m.MATTER_UNO = d.MATTER_UNOINNER JOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON c.CLIENT_UNO = m.CLIENT_UNO WHERE SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = @tran--AND NOT (EXPERT_DISB_STATUS = 'X' AND TRANSFERRED = 'S' )ORDER BY d.DISB_UNO SELECT ''[APT_INVPMT_DISB],* FROM APT_INVPMT_DISBWHERE INV_TRAN_UNO = @tran ORDER BY ROW_UNO || Step 3: Split Disb Items (use disb app) | Expected: Disb is Split Disb is split and both disbs have a tax row

Title: Sanity Test Expert Disbursements
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqAllow currency overrideTurn on Firm Options |  Allow Currency Override(Expert Admin ->Disbursements ->Disbursements Options -> Firm Options) Disb Type A - No unit rate Disb Type B- With unit rate : CAD$0.5 per 1 quantityNote: if Disb Code does not have unit rate, the disb currency will default from Office. If Disb Code have unit rate, disb currency will based on Firm Options | Currency | Base Currency, which is usually set to Matter Currency. | Expected: Setup Disb Code- Expert Admin > Disbursements > Disb Options > Disb Types- Can only setup Unit Rate in Classic > Client Disb > Setup > Disb Types (As in version 821) || Step 2: Create new Sessions1. In Sessions tab, create new Session.2. Fill in all the fields on the header. | Expected: Hard/Soft is required on the header. || Step 3: Add new Disbursements and Edit them inline1. Create two new disbursements.2. Edit them via Inline Edit3. Open and view, verify change is reflected on screen. | Expected: Disbursements open up on Disbursement Card.Changes made via inline edit should reflect on disb card and vice versa. || Step 4: Release Session | Expected: All disbursements under the sessions should be in Release stateVerify select*from CDT_DISB where SESSION= @sessionID[JLO 2024-03-25: WIP_STATUS = 'N', EXPERT_DISB_STATUS = 'R'] || Step 5: Unrelease Session | Expected: All disbursements under the sessions should be Edit state.Verify select*from CDT_DISB where SESSION= @sessionID[JLO 2024-03-25: WIP_STATUS = 'N', EXPERT_DISB_STATUS = 'E'] || Step 6: Post Session1. Recreate the two disbursements.2. Post Session. | Expected: Session is in Posted state.All disbursements under the sessions should be in WIP state.Verify select*from CDT_DISB where SESSION= @sessionID[JLO 2024-03-25: WIP_STATUS = 'W', EXPERT_DISB_STATUS = 'W'] || Step 7: Print Edit List (Required SSRS installed) | Expected: Verify the report have all the disbursements under the session. || Step 8: Change to Disb Tab || Step 9: Create, Save and Close1. Enter New Disbursement with Disb Type A C$100.2. Change the Bill Amount to C$150.3. Save and Close. | Expected: Bill Amount default from Base Amount. Re-enter Bill Amount do not change Base Amount.Amounts should display in disbursement currency in grid.Disb saved as Status = Edit. || Step 10: Open and Edit1. Open and change Disbursment Code to Disb Type B.2. Enter Quantity = 50.3.  Save and Close. | Expected: 2. Base and Bill Amount reset to Zero. Auto Calculation flag is checked.3. Base and Bill Amount is now C$25. || Step 11: Release and Unrelease1. Release disbursement.2. Unrelease disbursement. | Expected: 1. Disbursement status = Released.2. Disbursement status = Edit. || Step 12: Post and Edit1. Post disbursement.2. Edit disbursement using Edit ribbon button. Change the Client.Matter. Fill in the required fields, save and closed. | Expected: 1. Disbursement status = WIP.2. Verify that it is creating two mod rows for the edit. select * from CDT_DISB_MOD where DISB_UNO = @disbUno. 1 for previous matter with negative BASE_AMT_VAR and TOBILL_AMT_VAR, 1 for current matter with positive BASE_AMT_VAR and TOBILL_AMT_VAR- Verify the change is reflected on the grid. || Step 13: Mass Edit1. Title: Modern Auth Disbursements: sanity check list
Steps: Step 1: Note: clear cache is no longer used as it was just used due to the logout not always working. What it does is to remove the token folder from c:\Users\<user>\AppData\Local\Aderant\Identity\Note: login now should just ask you to select the account you want to use but not ask for a password as it will use your network loginNote: first time user will have a number sent to their phone (how do we clean up to test that first time user works? no-one seems to know, so at this point, we'll leave that as part of the infra testing) || Step 2: Pre ex0011 (or might have been an earlier release)Login/Logout1. Clear cache2. Login3. Logout4. Login | Expected: Step 2- Prompted for authentication- Logged into appStep 4- Not prompted for authentication- Logged into app || Step 3: Login/Logout1. Make sure you are in a logged out state- Open an app and selected to logout from the backstage2. Open app3. Logout | Expected: Step 2- Prompted to select the account you want to log into (you won't be required to enter a passwrod as it will use the network login)- Logged in and app openedStep 3- Prompted to select the account you want to log out of || Step 4: Edit List- Can use 204024 as a reference of how to do this | Expected: Edit list report is opened- Contains the records || Step 5: Create and save a disb - Can use 204234 as a reference of how to do this | Expected: Disbursement Saved- Correct user is set CDT_DISB.ENTRY_EMPL_UNO || Step 6: Disbursements Import - Can use 256694 as a reference of how to do this | Expected: Invoices imported- Correct user is set on the various tables e.g. CDT_DISB.ENTRY_EMPL_UNO || Step 7: Jobs- Run any job | Expected: Job is completed- Job can viewed in recent activity

Title: Negative disbursement in Expert Billing and Expert Disbursement
Steps: Step 1: Preconditions: || Step 2: Expert AP, Expert Billing & Expert Disbursement are accessible || Step 3: A Vendor & client/matter exist for testing || Step 4: To test transaction type - APX || Step 5: Open Expert AP and create an invoice with a disbursement line. Post the invoice. | Expected: Before invoice posted WIP_STATUS is 'N' in CDT_DISB After posting WIP_STATUS changes to 'W' || Step 6: Open Expert Billing and create a prebill for the above client/matter. Post the prebill. | Expected: When Pre-bill is prepared in CDT_Disb WIP_STATUS changes to 'P'When pre-bill is posted WIP_STATUS changes to 'B' || Step 7: Return to Expert AP and cancel the invoice created in the previous step. | Expected: It creates a new record (reversal line) in CDT_DISB table with Source_Tran_type as 'APX' and WIP_STATUS is 'W' || Step 8: Go back to Expert Billing and create a prebill for the same client/matter. | Expected: It changes WIP_STATUS of the new record to 'P' from 'W' || Step 9: Open the prebill created in Step 4 and click on 'Transfer'. | Expected: - On Expert Billing: The system should allow the transfer or split of a prebill with a negative disbursement. || Step 10: Verify if an error is displayed on save. If yes, log the error message. || Step 11: Return to Expert Billing and return the prebill from previous step to WIP. || Step 12: Open Expert Disbursement, edit the disbursement and save. | Expected: - On Expert Disbursement: The system should allow the editing of a disbursement with a negative amount. || Step 13: Verify if an error is displayed on save. If yes, log the error message. || Step 14: To test transaction type - CHX || Step 15: Open Expert AP and create a Payment with a disbursement line. Post the payment. || Step 16: Open Expert Billing and create a prebill for the above client/matter. Post the prebill. || Step 17: Return to Expert AP and cancel the payment created in the previous step. || Step 18: Go back to Expert Billing and create a prebill for the same client/matter. || Step 19: Open the prebill created in the previous step and click on 'Transfer'. | Expected: - On Expert Billing: The system should allow the transfer or split of a prebill with a negative disbursement. || Step 20: Verify if an error is displayed on save. If yes, log the error message. || Step 21: Return to Expert Billing and return the prebill from Step 4 to WIP. || Step 22: Open Expert Disbursement, edit the disbursement and save. | Expected: - On Expert Disbursement: The system should allow the editing of a disbursement with a negative amount. || Step 23: Verify if an error is displayed on save. If yes, log the error message.
